The ability to travel related to this role is required. Must be willing and able to travel up to 40% overnight locally, regionally, and nationally. Advance-level computer skills, and the ability to multitask without the direct oversight of manager required The ACAS will be hired for a specific company sales area and relocation to that pre-identified sales area after completion of the ACAS Training Program is required. Willingness and ability to relocate geographically within the United States is required. Discover A New Possible with Biosense Webster ACAS Program Video Biosense Webster Website Biosense Webster YouTube page Patient information on Afib Explanation of what Atrial Fibrillation (Afib) ablation is geared towards patients 10- minute video explaining the Afib ablation procedure Longer video showing detailed steps of the procedure J&J Credo Geographical Alignment for South East Area: Florida, Georgia, Louisiana (Baton Rouge, New Orleans)
DESCRIPTION: Attend all portions of the ACAS fellowship training program without exception. Engage in dialogue with multiple internal and external business partners and stakeholders, and formulate solutions based on dialogue and input gained during training. Understand the dynamics of an EP lab, including, but not limited to physicians, nurses and technicians, clinical and hospital administrators and staff. Prioritize and appropriately respond to requests in a high-stress environment. Maintain composure and problem-solving focus during stressful interactions. Respond daily to requests by email and voicemail. Drive collaboration and maintain consistent, open lines of communication across the assigned responsibilities with the local team/Pod (i.e. TM and other CAS), as well as the support team (i.e. field trainers, site trainers, RBD) and other internal and external partners Responsible for following all company guidelines related to health, safety and environmental practices and that all resources needed to do so are available and in good condition. Responsible for adhering to company compliance with all federal, state, local and company regulations, policies, and procedures.

TITLE: Supervisor II Facilities Maintenance
QUALIFICATIONS: Technically supervise or coordinate the work of engineers, draftspersons, technicians, and others who assist in specific assignments. Provide technical support for the approval/ validation of changes/ improvements in supplier processes SME in utilities systems like HVAC, dikes and secondary containment, WWTP, diesel storage and distribution, electrical systems, potable and purified water systems, boilers, compressed air, etc. Oversight of FM Service Provider daily performance and Site operational opportunities participating in the Tier 1 and Supervisor meetings as applicable. Identify recurrent opportunities in Site assets/ systems impacting Site operation, assign a root cause and build plan to mitigate/ eliminate the opportunity Support Facilities & Maintenance management with Capital Project Engineering, Facilities, Utilities and Validation Teams to ensure proper scheduling of tasks to minimize downtime in the production areas. Assists in preparing facilities budget and establishes effective cost control measures to meet budget targets. Provide technical support to the FM Service Provider to maintain the operating procedures of the area of responsibility up to date and oversight for the strict compliance. Support participating in IFM Governance Meetings and Processes including monthly SMT, inspections and similar. Leads and complete projects and/ or program of high level complexity ensuring safety, regulatory compliance, company standard, operation requirements and business needs. Works independently and coordinates and leads initiatives with other departments within the company and with other divisions outside the site. Collects data and prepares periodic reports for management on operational data including but not limited to energy consumption, water, steam and diesel consumption, important metrics and efficiency per system (CHW, RHW, Comp Air, Steam, Water). Provide support of the delivery and financial spending of Capital Projects as required by the projected financial cycle, safely and on time. Responsible as area owner of the project scope definition, technical support, aligned with the long-range plan. A Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering is required. Minimum of 6 years of related work experience is required. Experience working in Maintenance, Equipment Engineering, and/or Process Machinery area in the pharmaceutical industry, in a GMP product manufacturing plant environment is required. Proficiency in Microsoft Office programs (PowerPoint, Word, Excel and Outlook) is required. Basic management & supervision experience is required. Facilities management and project engineering experience is preferred. Technical knowledge of facilities management or related fields is required. Compliance Knowledge (GMP, EHS, and other regulatory standards/regulations) is required. Environmental and safety policies and guidelines knowledge is preferred. Ability to read schematics is preferred. Requires bilingual fluency in English and Spanish (oral and written) This position requires the availability to travel up 10% of the time.

TITLE: Health IT Marketing Product Manager, CVM - Janssen Pharmaceuticals, Inc.
QUALIFICATIONS: Support development of an integrated digital health strategy for organized customers segments with a focus on addressing digital barriers and using technology to improve population health Collaborate with CVM Health System Managers to apply and optimize current solutions and partnerships that work within HCP workflows across an extensive network of EHRs Contribute to the continual evolution of policies and standard operating procedures for the appropriate use of EHRs as a marketing channel. Understand new digital health trends and educate internal key partners and business leaders on marketing best practices. Test, learn and scale Innovative Approaches: Serve as a franchise expert in solving and educating on complex health information technology issues by identifying innovative approaches Bachelor’s Degree in relevant field required(e.g. business, marketing, technology, healthcare) Minimum 3 years of pharmaceutical sales or marketing experience, including digital channels required Experience developing marketing campaigns from concept to implementation, including understanding of U.S. promotional regulations and MLR review and approval process. Experience working within any of the following industries: pharmaceuticals, healthcare systems, health information technology (e.g. Electronic Health Records (Cerner/Epic)), payers (e.g. health insurance companies or pharmacy benefit managers) Foundational understanding of the U.S. health system ecosystem (providers, payers, health systems) Results-driven attitude with the ability to work under pressure, navigate ambiguity and balance multiple priorities Process documentation and program management experience Passion for crafting outstanding customer experiences Strong communication and listening skills Demonstrated track record of entrepreneurial thinking and related execution. Experience navigating evolving compliance and regulatory environment and related requirements Significant written and verbal communications skills Demonstrated collaboration skills and experience working with multiple, diverse teams and people EHR marketing experience a plus

TITLE: Postdoc Radiology AI
QUALIFICATIONS: Conceive, develop, and implement analytics and AI/Machine learning radiology solutions to high-priority scientific problems Participate in cross-functional collaborations with external companies and internal scientific, clinical, and data science teams Shape internal/external collaborations and define the scope of research questions Extract insight from sophisticated, unstructured radiology image or other imaging modalities data to improve drug discovery and healthcare (e.g., disease identification, patient stratification, disease insights) Clearly articulate highly technical methods and results to diverse audiences and partners to drive decision-making A Ph.D. degree in a quantitative field (e.g., artificial intelligence, computer science, applied mathematics, electrical engineering, or similar) Demonstrated experience driving research in and applying Computer Vision techniques, such as CNNs, RNNs, GANs, and radiomics, especially in radiology (e.g., MRI, CT, PET, Xray, etc.) Extensive hands-on experience with medical imaging modalities and formats (e.g., DICOM, nrrd, nifti) and collaborating with subject matter experts Proficiency with one or more programming language such as Python or C++ Extensive experience with traditional Computer Vision applications, such as OpenCV, object detection, edge detection, image segmentation Experience with machine learning algorithms, including random forest, SVM, boosting, neural networks, etc. Strong publication record and ability to optimally communicate technical work to a wide audience Hands-on technical data analysis, cloud computing (AWS, Azure), dockerization Experience with different imaging modalities and RWD data Familiarity with and exposure to drug discovery and clinical development processes Experience working closely with healthcare professionals Experience with meaningful disease biology in cancer, immunology, neuroscience, cardiovascular, or infectious disease Remote work options may be considered on a case-by-case basis and if approved by the Company.

TITLE: Senior Director EPM Deployment Leader
QUALIFICATIONS: Responsible for the financial leadership in the development & maintenance of the Global EPM (Enterprise Performance Mgmt, inclusive of Planning & Analytics) deployment strategy, approach & playbook inclusive of leading the sector deployment teams. Partners with business unit finance leaders, implementation leads, and SigniFi Program leaders to drive the global finance deployment activities including data conversion & master enablement, process readiness, testing & training activities and closely monitor functionality of implemented processes & technologies. This leader will lead the overall strategy and deployment of EPM business processes & technology applications across the sectors and will manage leaders who will directly deploy within a given sector. (Direct Rpts 2 Directors + 3 rd party advisory vendor(s). Partners with the business to ensure process & technology readiness is enabled inclusive of work placement, process documentation, training, data readiness, technology testing while leading knowledge transfer and hypercare approaches. Partners in conjunction with critical SigniFi Program Workstream Leaders (Cfin, CCER, TwT, PMO, DFIT, FTS, Financial Operations), BuF, and the business to align & integrate key milestones & deployments activities & timelines to ensure EPM activities are integrated into the SigniFi E2E timelines & deliverables. Solution interdependencies & trade-offs. Ensures financial processes & technology are enabled for compliance with worldwide operating procedures and drives accountability throughout the organization to activate new ways of working. Prepares and presents key presentation packages for senior management with succinct and concise communication Facilitates and drives resource prioritization with business partners to deploy & activate new process & technology activities. The leader will be a key thought leader in the development of the target state as it relates to data, processes, and technologies associated with planning & forecasting while influencing the change management & solution adoption across the globe. Provide leadership in the development & maintenance of the Global EPM deployment strategy, approach, & execution inclusive of leading the sector deployment teams. Provide financial leadership & critical support throughout the transformational deployment of Global Pharmaceutical, Global Vision, and Global Medical Device businesses Though leadership in the development of the target state as it relates to financial & non-financial data, process placement, and technology applications associated with planning & forecasting deployments. Influence the change management & solution adoption across the globe. QUALIFICATIONS: Help develop and co-own the long term strategic roadmap for end-to-end JET omni-channel development, with a specific focus on cross-TA capabilities. Collaborate and coordinate within a heavily matrixed environment across TA, AA, DE, and DE partners and Operations and other supporting teams to own and facilitate strategic prioritization of all AI/ML solutions within NA Janssen Commercial. A minimum of 3 years of relevant business experience in analytics, healthcare, management consulting or equivalent field is required (commercially relevant experience preferred) Experience applying AI/ML quantitative methods, predictive modeling and other analytics frameworks and techniques is required Experience with AI/ML enabled digital product development in a commercial, medical affairs, scientific affairs and/or R&D environment is required Ability to translate business questions into fit-for-purpose analytical solutions, and interpret outcomes of data science models into meaningful business insights and actionable recommendations is required Strong communication skills with ability to present complex messages and trade-offs and tell a compelling story is required Experience influencing and facilitating effective internal communications and collaborations in a matrixed and fast-paced environment is required Strong partnering skills and technical domain know-how to successfully lead, engage and influence colleagues is required Proven experience in prioritizing and managing a complicated portfolio of projects required Expertise in developing closed loop digital products ad platforms is highly preferred Experience in closely working with a team of data scientists and software developers to ensure timely development and adoption of data science solutions is highly preferred Passion to challenge the status quo and find new solutions and drive out of the box ideas while embracing change is required The anticipated base pay range for this position is $111,000 to $192,050.

TITLE: Scientist, Molecular Pathology
QUALIFICATIONS: Accountability for the design, development, and implementation of molecular pathology assays. Demonstrate proficiency in designing and performing single/multiplex immunohistochemistry, in situ hybridization for the evaluation of target(s) expression in nonclinical and clinical species. Generates molecular pathology data with the application of multiple pathology platforms (autostainers, spatial profiling, multispectral imaging). Perform or oversee the design and execution of orthogonal experiments complementary to molecular pathology workflow, including generation of control cell lines, flow cytometry, immunoblot, PCR. Maintain current and accurate electronic laboratory notebook entries for data integrity. Attends and presents at pertinent internal and external scientific meetings. Authors comprehensive and integrated validation, technical, and investigational molecular pathology reports. Generates written reports and delivers effective communications to internal team members and management. May assist, perform, or supervise routine histology workload (e.g., FFPE and OCT matrices), including but not limited to tissue trimming, processing, embedding, sectioning, and staining (H&E, special stains, and molecular pathology assays such as localization of target genes and proteins using immunohistochemical and in situ hybridization staining). May assist, perform, or coordinate tissue collection for molecular pathology process optimization. Works closely with Pathologists, Toxicologists, and other scientists within and outside of NCS’ functional groups. A Ph.D. degree or equivalent (area of focus in pathology, molecular pathology or related fields) with 1-3 years of relevant experience, or a M.S. degree in the same fields with at least 10 years of relevant experience is required. Experience and technical skills in applied molecular pathology and tissue technology is required. Experience with diverse automated histology and molecular pathology platforms is required. Histotechnology expertise is required. Broad scientific knowledge and hands-on experience with background literature and database research is required. Strong interpersonal communication skills and experience in working with diverse teams globally is required. HT/HTL certification is an asset. A strong publication record in relevant scientific fields is a plus. This position is located in La Jolla, CA and may require up to 5% of domestic and international travel.

Generates molecular pathology data with the application of multiple pathology platforms (autostainers, spatial profiling, multispectral imaging). Perform or oversee the design and execution of orthogonal experiments complementary to molecular pathology workflow, including generation of control cell lines, flow cytometry, immunoblot, PCR. Maintain current and accurate electronic laboratory notebook entries for data integrity. Attends and presents at pertinent internal and external scientific meetings. Authors comprehensive and integrated validation, technical, and investigational molecular pathology reports. Generates written reports and delivers effective communications to internal team members and management. May assist, perform, or supervise routine histology workload (e.g., FFPE and OCT matrices), including but not limited to tissue trimming, processing, embedding, sectioning, and staining (H&E, special stains, and molecular pathology assays such as localization of target genes and proteins using immunohistochemical and in situ hybridization staining). May assist, perform, or coordinate tissue collection for molecular pathology process optimization. Works closely with Pathologists, Toxicologists, and other scientists within and outside of NCS’ functional groups.

TITLE: Sales Associate, Trauma – Dothan, AL – DePuy Spine Limited Partnership
QUALIFICATIONS: Assist DePuy Synthes sales organization in retaining and supporting further penetration with existing customers, while supporting product conversions with new customers. Assist in the attainment of established sales goals including market share objectives in prescribed territory. Apply knowledge of sales process, product portfolio and customer knowledge to improve sales outcomes. Guide and assist surgeons in the operating room through their clinical and product knowledge. Use product knowledge to present, demonstrate, and ensure accurate utilization of DePuy Synthes products Support customers by attending surgeries, assuring that the proper equipment is available and performing, including ways to optimize trays; Provide Operating Room and Sterile Processing Department consultation Troubleshoot and provide other technical assistance; handle customer requests, effectively lead hospital billing, build/close purchase orders Share key customer, procedural and marketplace insights with other sales, clinical, marketing and strategic account teams to improve on solutions/service levels. Prepare sales reports and documents as the need arises Maintenance, tracking and effective deployment of equipment, and assets throughout assigned area ensuring product availability. Ensure all promotional materials are maintained in a presentable manner. Ensure DePuy Synthes Services and offering meet the highest quality standards. Focus on customer satisfaction and retention; and improving the customers’ insights into DePuy Synthes tangible and non-tangible value proposition and solutions. Differentiate DPS’s products versus competition by providing the customer unique insights. A valid driver's license issued in the United States Ability to travel which may include weekend and/or overnight travel. Residence in or ability to relocate to the posted territory. Strong interpersonal communication, influencing, critical thinking and problem solving skills required. A qualified candidate will be efficient, organized, self-motivated, positive and pro-active Strong technical product knowledge of surgical instruments, procedures, protocols and solutions preferred

TITLE: Research & Development Leadership Development Program (RDLDP)- 2023 Full-Time
QUALIFICATIONS: You will have opportunities to participate and/or lead in rotational assignments encompassing entire project or a large portion of a major project. This may include resolving advanced materials, process, inspection/testing or procedural approaches to advance a medical device through the pipeline process into full R&D, and potentially into commercialization. Support of products’ design development, manufacturing, and commercialization, leveraging technical expertise to anticipate and proactively address challenges and risks. Increase the productivity of product’s design utilizing CAD, improve the quality of projects, improve communications through documentation, and to create a database for manufacturing. Engineer capabilities required to develop and deliver automated medical devices - including requisite instruments, advanced imaging, and user interface / experience. Pursue a number of internal developmental training programs as well as externally recognized qualifications such as Process Design Excellence. Opportunity to work in a fast-paced cross functional, technologically advanced corporate environment in a program focused on developing individual engineers capable of pursuing careers across medical device businesses and high-volume manufacturers. Currently enrolled in an Engineering Graduate Program (Master’s Degree or PhD) graduating by June 2023. The following engineering disciplines or specialties are preferred: Mechanical, Robotics, Electrical, Computer, Systems, Software, Materials Science, Biomedical and Computer Science. The following concentration fields and/or skills are strongly preferred: Machine Learning, IoT, Embedded Software, Deep Machine Learning, Prototyping, Robot Design, Systems Reliability, Firmware, and hardware integration. A minimum GPA of 3.3 is strongly preferred. You must have the ability to work closely with technical and non-technical personnel and have excellent communication skills with the ability to influence others. You must have the ability to demonstrate excellent problem-solving skills, intellectual curiosity, and a dedicated approach to achieving success. Validated leadership experience through extra-curricular activities, employment and/or internship experiences is required. R&D internship highly preferred. Ability to relocate anywhere in the United States as required by the program’s rotations – mandatory requirement.

TITLE: BioSurgery R&D Formulation Co-Op
QUALIFICATIONS: Individual will design and conduct experiments and perform biochemical and analytical laboratory procedures including, protein chemistry, polymer characterization, physical analyses, microscopy, spectroscopy, and moisture analysis. Record data and observations in laboratory notebooks. Analyze experimental data, interpret results, conduct statistical comparisons and prepare technical reports. Individual will maintain laboratory equipment, reagents and supplies. Prepare stock solutions and reagents, including weight measurements and utilize a pH meter to prepare buffer solutions. Must comply with safety and GLP guidelines including maintaining up to date training, following SOPs, maintaining equipment, and proper documentation of lab notebooks and logbooks. This individual should be able to communicate effectively (both oral and written communication) with co-workers. Qualified candidate must have the ability to work independently and as part of a team. Candidates must be enrolled a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Bio/Biomedical Engineering, Materials/Biomaterial Engineering, Chemistry, Biochemistry, Biology, Medical Technology or a related technical field. A minimum G.P.A. of 3.2 is preferred. At least 2 years of previous laboratory experience is required. Lab experience in an industry setting is preferred. Understanding of polymer chemistry and characterization methods is a plus. Experience in working in cross functional teams is a plus Candidate must be available to work full-time (40 hours/week) Excellent written and verbal communication skills Proficient in use and application of commonly used word processing, spreadsheet, graphics, and database software such as Minitab, MATLAB or SPSS (statistical)
DESCRIPTION: Individual will design and conduct experiments and perform biochemical and analytical laboratory procedures including, protein chemistry, polymer characterization, physical analyses, microscopy, spectroscopy, and moisture analysis.

TITLE: Quality Operations Leader - Raynham, MA
QUALIFICATIONS: Establishes and maintains quality assurance programs, procedures, and controls including associated leading and/or lagging quality indicators at the value stream level as applicable. Ensures that performance and quality of products conform to established company and regulatory standards (including but not limited to US FDA 21 CFR parts 820 & 4, ISO13485, Canadian Medical Device Regulation, European MDD / MDR, ANVISA, TGA, Japan MHLW 169 and China GMP.) Provide support and/or lead investigations, bounding, documentation, review and approval of non-conformances, CAPAs and customer complaints. Support, lead and/or develop strategies as applicable to drive supply reliability, improvements in manufacturing capabilities, consistent execution to financial targets, and design (product and process) reliability of new and existing products. Review, analyze and disposition IQ, OQ, PQ, TMV or Software Validation. Assess the need for risk mitigation techniques given product classification, potential defect types, defect frequency, severity, customer risk, process capability, process controls, among others. Ownership and accountability of risk assessment process including conducting, documenting, reviewing or maintaining current risk and hazard analysis documentation such as Process FMEAs. Determine effectiveness of these techniques on previously implemented improvements. Lead and/or support the data collection to conduct needed analytical/statistical analysis and interpretation as part of process improvements and day-to-day support. Standardize and develop methods/techniques. These may include descriptive, graphical, gage R&R/measurement system, reliability, capability, control chart analysis, confidence intervals, hypothesis testing, analysis of variance, design of experiments, among others. Acts as advisor to subordinate staff to help meet established schedules or resolve technical or operational problems. Develop and track quality control objectives and coordinates objectives with preproduction and production procedures in partnership with applicable multi-functional teams to enhance product reliability and minimize costs. Supports development of a fiscal budget to support quality assurance, supply reliability and compliance objectives. Forecasts and handles headcount, capital, and other resource needs. Coordinates and supervises activities related to internal audits to assure compliance with company, state, federal, and international standards. Ensures that the site is in a constant state of readiness for internal or external audits. Acts as host during external audits. Monitors and supports supplier / site quality performance to ensure that the end-to-end supply chain meets Quality assurance objectives. Facilitates the development and training of Quality and Manufacturing personnel. Leads (directly or through indirect influence) as applicable an extended quality and compliance organization, such as Receiving Inspection, Final Release, Manufacturing Quality Operations, Documentation Control, Training, and Compliance audits for manufacturing site. Responsible for communicating business related issues via defined risk management board process or opportunities to next management level. A minimum of a Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering or equivalent technical field. 8 plus years related experience. 4 plus years specific experience in a management/supervisory role with direct reports Deep understanding of medical device regulations and experience working in both an FDA and European regulatory environment. Ability to read, analyze and interpret complex documents and drawings including the ability to apply analytical techniques to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions. Technical Training and/or experience related to Statistics Analysis, Lean and Six Sigma Methodologies is required. Ability to handle effective communication of sensitive and/or complex topics with multiple audiences, including team members, peers and managers as well as communication upward through senior management. Strong mentoring, coaching and leadership skills are required. Ability to successfully handle communication with representatives of various government agencies. Advanced Technical Training and experience using Statistics, Lean and Six Sigma Methodologies is required including Measurement System Analysis, SPC, DOEs, Reliability is preferred. Expertise in New Product Introduction (NPI) process and Process Validation expertise is preferred. A thorough understanding of GMP/ISO regulations and validation regulations is preferred.

TITLE: Associate Director, RIM Data Standards, Governance & Operations
QUALIFICATIONS: Assesses processes to ensure that organizational responsibilities are met for quality, delivery, and effectiveness. · Develops opportunities for business process improvement. Lead and facilitate the compliance and implementation of EMA SPOR IDMP as well as future regulatory authority SPOR implementations. Identify gaps and develop reusable IDMP assessment frameworks. Knowledge of external factors (standards, regulatory requirements) that impact the work. Excellent verbal and written communication skills, ability to work and thrive in a multi-cultural environment, and ability to work in a matrix environment. Experience leading and motivating internationally based high performance teams. Experience leading projects and driving change initiatives in a global, outsourced and matrix management environment. Strong decision making and problem-solving skills. Ability to manage and prioritize multiple workstreams Facilitation, presentation and meeting management skills for internal and external audiences at all levels. Conflict resolution/management and negotiation skills. Knowledge of global regulatory affairs and in-depth understanding across and outside of regulatory affairs. Knowledge of the drug development and safety business area processes. Experience with vendor management. This position may require up to 5-10% domestic and international travel.

TITLE: Principal Scientist, Analytical
QUALIFICATIONS: Develop characterization strategies and implements plans to characterize iPSCs, cell and gene engineering, and cell differentiation, in particular gamma/delta T cells, NK cells or related cell types. Lead a team of scientists developing and optimizing analysis methods that fully characterize human iPSCs and iPSC-derived cells using multi-parameter flow cytometry and in vitro assays for cell proliferation, cytokine secretion, polyfunctionality, and target cell killing. Manage characterization plans for assessing on-target and off-target editing activity by ICE, flow cytometry, ELISA, qPCR, western blot, and others. Direct technical forums both internal and external to the company to share knowledge and approaches related to cellular characterization strategies as they relate to cell-based therapies (CAR-T, CAR-NK, etc.). Engage and/or lead technical investigation strategies in support of product investigations with respect to clinical outcomes or adverse events driving to root cause. Develop innovative approaches to challenging solutions. Identify/collaborate with partners in academia or industry to implement innovation ideas or characterization approaches. Effectively communicate scientific data and results across technical teams, project teams, and to the health authority as needed. M.S. degree with 10 years of experience in an academic or industry setting with a focus in the field of human iPSC biology or Ph.D. in cell biology, immunology, biological science, or related field with 7 years of experience. Proven experience in NK/T cell biology, function and iPSC-NK/T cell differentiation is required. Human iPSC subject matter expert able to apply skills, theoretical knowledge, and experience to provide scientific direction and approach to projects and challenges is required. Ability to work collaboratively in a complex, environment is required. Expertise with primary T-cell and pluripotent SC culture, viral and non-viral gene delivery methods and cellular based assays is required. Experience with in vitro technologies to assess lymphocyte functionality including but not limited to multi-parameter flow cytometry, MSD, Luminex, xCELLigence and IncuCyte-based assays, for phenotypic characterization of T/NK cells, T/NK cell activation, cytotoxicity and proliferation assays is required. Excellent oral and written communication skills is required. Ability to independently design, implement and troubleshoot experiments, analyze, reports and present data is required. Must be detailed, highly organized, able to manage multiple tasks with tight timelines and deliver quality data. Knowledge of the connections between clinical, process/product development, and biological outcomes is preferred. Experience with the development and registration of cell therapies is a plus. Awareness of GMP requirements is desired. Ability to make timely decisions and operate effectively in times of ambiguity is highly preferred. Strong analytical problem solving, planning and organizational skill is desired. People leadership experience, working in a team or direct line setting, is a plus.

TITLE: Established Prod. CVM/PH Clinical Intern
QUALIFICATIONS: Work with the Clinical and overall CVM/PH compound development teams (CDT) and their internal and external partners in the execution of specific tasks and projects in CVM/PH related to clinical studies, pediatric development and strategic activities conducted for the support of this portfolio. Work in concert with the Clinical Leaders on clinical trial and Real World Evidence (RWE) concept and protocol development, execute clinical studies for new formulations, post-approval commitments, and new indications. Be actively involved in creation of Clinical Study Reports (CSRs), publication of clinical research findings and presentations to relevant FDA, EMA, or other Health Authorities, advisory committees, and review meetings. Participate in cross-functional teams for evaluation of new product ideas and related new technologies; review medical literature, clinical, medical and market access plans. You are passionate about science & operational excellence. You have strong problem-solving skills for developing solutions and meeting project objectives. You have demonstrated ability of critical thinking and prioritization with respect to project objectives. You should have a demonstrated track record of possessing an ability to innovate and generate change and solution-oriented input to address challenges in the work place and/or academia. You are detail-oriented, highly organized and able to manage multiple tasks while maintaining a strong sense of urgency. You possess good interpersonal skills and are able to work effectively in a collaborative team environment You are proficient with Microsoft Office, Word, Excel and Power Point. You must be able to embrace diversity and collaboration in the workplace with an open minded and collaborative approach. Demonstrated project leadership experience is preferred. Demonstrated experience working on phase 2-4 industry trials strongly preferred. Proven experience in Epidemiology particularly in research activities in RWE a plus. TITLE: Staff Quality Engineer QE4
QUALIFICATIONS: Working with other functional groups, including R&D and Operations in support of new product development, engineering projects, quality assurance activities, and lifecycle management. Utilizing Quality Engineering tools/processes in development and implementation of practices for the effective and efficient development, transfer, and maintenance of products/processes throughout the product lifecycle. Leading efforts with quality improvement opportunities as appropriate to legacy products, continuous improvement and customer satisfaction. Support sterility, biocompatibility and packaging test requirements following company standard operation procedures for new products. Carries out complex or novel assignments requiring the development of new or improved techniques or procedures. Assesses the feasibility and soundness of proposed engineering evaluation tests, products or equipment, when necessary, data are insufficient or confirmation by testing is advisable. Responsible for communicating business related issues or opportunities to next management levels. TITLE: Neuroscience TA La Jolla
QUALIFICATIONS: Develop, conduct, and interpret in vitro experiments using human iPSC-derived neurons to investigate neuronal activity and plasticity. Use various experimental approaches, including qRT-PCR, RNAScope, immunocytochemistry, and MEA electrophysiology, to generate expression and functional data. Candidates must be enrolled in an accredited college pursuing a bachelor’s degree, master’s degree, or PhD in neuroscience, biology, pharmacology, or related field. Students entering their final year of studies (graduation in 2024) preferred. Candidates must be available in Summer of 2023 and able to work full-time during the duration of the internship. Candidates must be legally authorized to work in the United States and not require sponsorship for employment visa status (e.g. H1-B status) now or in the future. Should be comfortable working independently as well as on a team. Candidates need to be proficient with Microsoft Office, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint. Additional technical competencies in GraphPad Prism or other statistical software are highly desirable, as is experience with PubMed or other literature databases. Excellent organization, communication, presentation skills and scientific/technical writing skills. A minimum G.P.A. of 3.0 is strongly preferred. Housing will not be offered for this internship.

TITLE: Product Management Staff Engineer
QUALIFICATIONS: Under the direction of the applicable PM Manager and in accordance with all applicable federal, state, and local laws/regulations and Corporate Johnson & Johnson, procedures and guidelines, this position: Plans, documents, and executes new process development, designed experiments, validations, qualifications (IQ, OQ and PQ), testing, and design control deliverables in order to launch high-quality, compliant new products into manufacturing while meeting time, cost and margin targets. Monitors and supports new product processes until stabilized, and fully transferred into production. Leads and implements projects and/or programs of moderate to high-level complexity ensuring safety, regulatory compliance, company standards, operation requirements, and business needs are met. Provides project management guidance and business tools, applying a systematic approach to project execution. Prepares management reports and presentations. Effective project planning and structure. Develops imaginative strategies for the efficient completion of projects. Sets the engineering standard and direction for the group and is recognized as the source of guidance in a field. Leads the optimization of process output and throughput, equipment utilization, equipment downtime, waste reduction/yield improvements, budget management, and standard cost, and capital investment management in an innovative manner. Challenges the “status quo” on a routine basis and develops new ideas within incoming processes. Coordinates phases of work with other departments within the company and with other Ethicon divisions. Technical support to Manufacturing Business Units for complex process issues, where a higher level of technical expertise in a given field of knowledge is required. Follows Standard Operating Procedures (SOP), Good Manufacturing Practices (GMPs), Company Policies, and Federal, State, and Local Government Regulations. Revise and maintain engineering, equipment, and process procedures. Participates in GMP audits regarding equipment recording and machine performance. Coordinates communications and collaborates with end users, machine manufacturers, and/or suppliers. Participates in projects involving other departments and activities (CIM, QIP, CFM, etc.). Writes, develops, and implements validation procedures. Follow J&J Safety Requirements and ensure safe working conditions and practices in the department. Reviews and analyzes data, understand statistics and the application of statistical data, able to resolve normal and non-normal data along with probable causes of non-normal results. Demonstrate independent understanding and application of core GMP fundamentals, including but not limited to Data Integrity (DI), Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP), and Good Documentation Practices (GDPs). Responsible for communicating business-related issues or opportunities to the next management level Responsible for ensuring personal and Company compliance with all Federal, State, local, and Company regulations, policies, and procedures Performs other duties assigned as needed. Advanced computer skills and use of software applications. Strong computer background (MS Office, MS Project Management, PowerPoint, Word, Excel, Outlook, etc.). Experience in a manufacturing environment developing manufacturing standards. Proficient in project management, creating credibility among team members, and expanding the capabilities of the group. Experience or knowledge in short and long-term project management. Strong Organizational, interpersonal, oral, and written communication skills. Ability to prioritize multiple commitments and technical problem-solving duties. Ability to shift priorities according to changes in department/facility needs and open to different ideas/approaches. Ability to periodically interact with associates and processes in a unique environment such as a clean room. Ability to wear protective gear such as lab or clean room gowns. This position will involve periodic entry into a clean room production environment which requires certain preparation and gowning practices.

TITLE: Posdoctoral Fellow - Immunology
QUALIFICATIONS: Crafting, performing and interpreting ex vivo experiments with primary human tissue and immune cells isolated from biopsy tissue or blood. QUALIFICATIONS: Provide routine veterinary care for assigned area(s) of clinical responsibility, including participating in an on-call schedule to provide after-hours and weekend veterinary coverage. TITLE: Senior Scientist, Analytical Development
QUALIFICATIONS: Develop characterization strategies and implement plans to understand the cellular biology with respect to growth/expansion of cellular subtypes during process/product development in both autologous and allogenic production processes. Create methods to monitor cellular immunophenotypes engaged in selection, activation, transduction, expansion and cryopreservation. Engage and/or lead technical investigation strategy in support of product investigations with respect to clinical outcomes or adverse events driving to root cause. Identify/collaborate with partners in academia or industry to complete innovation ideas or characterization approaches. Effectively communicate scientific data and results across technical teams, project teams, and to the health authority as needed. M.S. degree with 5 years of experience in an academic or industry setting with a focus on T cell biology or cellular characterization/function or Ph.D. in cell biology, immunology, biological science, or a related field with 3 years of experience. Experience with in vitro technologies to assess lymphocyte functionality including but not limited to multi-parameter flow cytometry, MSD, Luminiex, xCELLigence and IncuCyte-based assays, for phenotypic characterization of T/NK cells, T/NK cell activation, cytotoxicity and proliferation assays is required. Immune cell biology expert able to apply skills, theoretical knowledge, and experience to provide scientific direction and approach to projects and challenges is required. Excellent oral and written communication skills is required. Ability to work collaboratively in a sophisticated environment is required. Minimum of 2 years experience working in therapeutic cell therapy research or development groups is preferred. Expertise with primary T-cell, iPSCs, viral and non-viral gene delivery methods and cellular based assays is preferred. Ability to independently design, complete and troubleshoot experiments, analyze reports and present data is preferred. Must be thorough, highly organized and able to manage multiple tasks, handle, tight timelines and deliver quality data. Knowledge of the connections between clinical, process/product development, and biological outcomes is preferred. Awareness to GMP requirements. Strong analytical problem solving, planning and organizational skills is preferred.

TITLE: Regulatory Affairs Post Doctoral Fellow
QUALIFICATIONS: Gain experience and exposure to groundbreaking programs and strategies for compounds in development and/or marketed products intended to address unmet medical needs in markets globally. Learn the laws, guidances, and regulatory requirements for drugs and combination products while being accountable to the organization's objectives. Accountability is the cornerstone of our culture. We demonstrate our compassion for patients, and work hard to honor our commitment for those who depend on us to develop innovative therapies. Support innovative thinking and contribute to fresh innovative solutions in Regulatory Affairs. Innovation is our passion and mission as well as a fundamental requirement in our pursuit to create world-class medicines. Develop leadership and creative problem solving skillsets, to become an inventive regulatory leader in the healthcare field of interest. As part of the two-year experiential Fellowship program, all GRA Fellows complete a project for presentation to the GRA Senior Leadership Team and other internal partners. Earned a bachelor's degree (B.S. or B.A.) from a 4-year university program. Earned or is currently pursuing an advanced degree in scientific, technology or engineering related field from an accredited academic institution. Examples include, biomedical engineering, data analytics/applied statistics, quantitative modeling in biology, pharmacy or other healthcare science. Strong academic track record is required. Some fundamental understanding of pharmaceutical drug development. Knowledge of current Food and Drug Administration (FDA) regulations, guidelines, and submission requirements is desired. Proven leadership capabilities in an organizational setting (campus/community activities) is desired. Able to work independently, as well as, be part of a group, with curiosity and flexibility. Be self-motivated, possess a “can do” approach, and courage to speak your voice and suggest innovative ideas. Be a creative problem solver, with an interest in exploring the international context of healthcare systems and technology contexts. Desired assignment location is New Jersey or Pennsylvania and may require local travel. Remote work options may be considered on a case-by-case basis and if approved by the Company.
DESCRIPTION: Gain experience and exposure to groundbreaking programs and strategies for compounds in development and/or marketed products intended to address unmet medical needs in markets globally. Learn the laws, guidances, and regulatory requirements for drugs and combination products while being accountable to the organization's objectives. Accountability is the cornerstone of our culture. We demonstrate our compassion for patients, and work hard to honor our commitment for those who depend on us to develop innovative therapies. Support innovative thinking and contribute to fresh innovative solutions in Regulatory Affairs. TITLE: Supply Chain Sustainability Intern
QUALIFICATIONS: Support efforts to reach carbon neutrality across our global operations by advancing innovations in our facilities and our supply chain to conserve and protect water and to rethink waste. Support efforts to deliver sustainable products and solutions by integrating sustainable design solutions into our product innovation processes, considering the environmental impacts throughout a products’ lifecycle from design and formulation, through raw material sourcing and manufacturing, to packaging and deliver, and products us and end-of-life. Execute and maintain sustainability benchmarking exercise; gathering externally available data, creating MS PowerPoint and/or MS Excel based summaries, and present to leadership on findings. Support the development and maintenance of tools for measuring sustainability improvements versus company objectives and goals. Create resources and content that raise the sustainability IQ of the organization Candidates must be enrolled in an accredited college/institution pursuing a bachelor’s or master’s degree in Packaging Engineering, Environmental Engineering, Environmental Sciences, Environmental Health, or related major. Also open to candidates that have some Marketing background. Only students in their second year or above will be considered. A minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0 is strongly preferred. Demonstrated leadership/participation in campus programs and/or community service activities. Candidate must be considered a student (i.e. will not have already graduated college). Candidate must be available to part-time (20 hours/week). Working knowledge of Microsoft Office Products and ability to communicate effectively both verbally and written is required. Must be authorized to work in the U.S. and not require sponsorship now or in the future.

TITLE: Integrated Data Analytics and Reporting (IDAR) Co Op
QUALIFICATIONS: RM-CM leads the risk-based approach to monitoring clinical trials to help ensure protection of human subjects and the quality of clinical trial data. The RM-CM group is responsible for each detection, analysis, and mitigation of potential risks in clinical trials. How you can make a difference: Apply your knowledge of data science, analytical acuity, understanding of statistical concepts, and ability to learn and adapt to new technology to the monitoring of our clinical trials. Candidates must be legally authorized to work in the U.S. and must not require sponsorship for employment visa status now, or in the future (e.g., H1‑B). Candidate must be actively enrolled in an accredited University for the duration of a co-op assignment pursuing a Bachelor’s, Master’s and/or MBA. Completion of Undergraduate Freshmen year at accredited University is required. Availability to work 40 hours per week.

TITLE: Manager, NA Trade Compliance Operations
QUALIFICATIONS: Lead a team of 4 trade compliance professionals while providing training and development opportunities. Provide direction to functional areas that share import-export responsibilities with the NA Trade Compliance Team to ensure J&J imports, exports, and R&D activities comply with import-export laws. Address and resolve inquiries from government agencies such as CBP, FDA, Census, and the BIS. Report clearance performance and develop strategies to reduce risk of supply chain delays. Conduct import-export assessments, develop training, and implement compliance improvement plans. Identify new opportunities to participate in duty savings opportunities which include, but are not limited to drawback, foreign trade zones, and free trade agreements. Conduct periodic compliance checks on daily import and export transactions to ensure compliance, and work with Operations to develop remediation plans to address deficiencies. Support the implementation of a global trade compliance program as well as the standardization of policies, processes, procedures, metrics, and tools. Develop management action plans (MAPs) to remediate compliance issues to include ensuring appropriate investigation, closure, and process governance. This person is accountable for Trade Compliance governance activities across the entire supply chain in partnership with Planning, Regulatory Affairs, Quality, External Manufacturing, Franchise Integration, Logistics Procurement, Legal, and Finance. This position also monitors and assesses changing and emerging industry regulations applicable to import and export activities. Minimum Bachelor's degree is required. Minimum 5 years of Trade Compliance experience in a highly regulated industry required. Requires experience in logistics, customer service, transportation, distribution, operations, supply chain, and/or information technology Strong collaboration, influencing skills to inspire trust and effectively build relationships is required. Strong interpersonal and collaboration skills to succeed with internal and external business partners Proven experience in driving decisions and results in a highly complex and rapidly changing environment Proven analytical experience and ability to thrive in a dynamic work environment People leadership experience required Six Sigma/Process Excellence Tools, Training or certification preferred

QUALIFICATIONS: BSME or equivalent required with 6 or more years proven experience designing and building electro-mechanical parts and assemblies required. Experience working with vendors to select, source, quote, and procure off the shelf and custom designed components. Basic knowledge of working in an ISO and FDA regulated environment. Consistent track record working well in a team environment, learning from others, as well as mentoring and coaching more junior team members.

TITLE: Head of High Order Structure Characterization
QUALIFICATIONS: Drive the operational, strategic, and scientific strategy for applying innovative biophysical characterization techniques towards the selection of biologics at Janssen. Establish a robust operational process for using these techniques on a broad portfolio of therapeutic programs and platforms. Recruit, train, mentor, manage, and evaluate a team of ~6-8 scientists focused on characterization of higher order structure of biologics. Collaborate with peers in Biophysics, Lead Engineering, and Protein Expression Sciences groups to provide a comprehensive analysis of the molecular properties. Work with downstream drug development teams in Cell Line Development, Drug Product Development and Analytical Development to ensure efficient transfer of project and molecular information and selection of developable candidates. Advise/mentor project teams and project leaders on the successful selection of clinical candidates with appropriate physical characteristics. Build an environment that encourages technical and scientific innovation and continuous improvement. Ph.D. in Analytical Chemistry, Biochemistry, Biophysics, or related field with a minimum of 10 years relevant experience is required. Experience using numerous biophysical analytical techniques like chromatography, DSC, DSF, AUC, cIEF, DLS, SLS, or forced degradation studies to characterize biologics is required. Strong understanding of protein/antibody structure function relationships is required. Excellent written and oral communication skills is required. Ability to clearly articulate scientific concepts and results across research functions is required. Highly recognized for scientific contributions including peer reviewed first-author publications, patent applications, and presentations at major national meetings is required. Experience directly leading and developing a scientific staff is required. Knowledge of techniques to build and analyze large data sets for predictive modeling and in silico tools for molecule selection is preferred. Experience leading therapeutic discovery programs is preferred. Experience building or working with modern lab automation and high-throughput analysis is preferred.
DESCRIPTION: Drive the operational, strategic, and scientific strategy for applying innovative biophysical characterization techniques towards the selection of biologics at Janssen. Establish a robust operational process for using these techniques on a broad portfolio of therapeutic programs and platforms. Recruit, train, mentor, manage, and evaluate a team of ~6-8 scientists focused on characterization of higher order structure of biologics. Collaborate with peers in Biophysics, Lead Engineering, and Protein Expression Sciences groups to provide a comprehensive analysis of the molecular properties. Work with downstream drug development teams in Cell Line Development, Drug Product Development and Analytical Development to ensure efficient transfer of project and molecular information and selection of developable candidates. Advise/mentor project teams and project leaders on the successful selection of clinical candidates with appropriate physical characteristics. Build an environment that encourages technical and scientific innovation and continuous improvement.

TITLE: Principal Scientist, Compound Logistics & Lead Evaluation Process and Screening Automation
QUALIFICATIONS: Manage end-to-end laboratory operations for the Compound Logistics and Lead Evaluation Process and Automation teams, including compound logistics workflows, laboratory automation and automated assay execution to support the Lead Evaluation & Cellular Pharmacology screening activities at the La Jolla site. Support the life cycle management, solving, maintenance, and continuous improvement of implemented robotic systems, while continuing to innovate to meet the changing needs of the business. Bachelor’s, Master’s or an Advanced Degree is required in molecular biology, chemistry, engineering or related field. Minimum of 10 or more years of experience in automation and liquid handling. Experience in managing technology infrastructure, end-to-end and day-to-day assay platform operation is preferred. Direct experience in design and implementing of complex cell biology assay workflows and automation system is preferred. People management experience is preferred, including the management of Ph.D., M.S., and B.S. scientists/engineers and/or contractors. Hands-on hardware/programming experience with robotic liquid handlers (e.g. Tecan, Hamilton, Beckman, Agilent) and robotic integration / scheduling software (e.g. HighRes Biosolutions Cellario or Thermo Scientific Momentum) is preferred. Experience managing capital equipment procurement projects including specification development, supplier selection, technical reviews, installation, and qualification of robotic automation equipment is preferred. Ability to interact with all levels within the organization, as well as with suppliers and vendors is preferred. Working knowledge with data analysis and visualization software such as Prism, Genedata, and Spotfire is preferred.

TITLE: Associate Scientist, Electrophysiology
QUALIFICATIONS: Provide support for ion channel programs in a multidisciplinary team. Develop, troubleshoot, and validate functional assays. Conduct high-throughput screening for neurological disease targets. Rapidly analyze experimental data and present results at project and group meetings. B.S. degree in Neuroscience, Pharmacology, or a related biology field with a minimum of 4 years of laboratory experience or M.S. degree in Neuroscience, Pharmacology, or a related biology field with a minimum of 2 years of laboratory experience is required. Mammalian cell culture experience and ability to maintain multiple cell lines is required. Experience independently performing patch-clamp experiments using manual OR automated electrophysiology systems is required. Working knowledge of ion channel biology and target mechanisms, along with familiarity interpreting patch-clamp data is required. Excellent verbal and written communication skills are required. Ability to run high-throughput cell-based assays is highly desirable, particularly if experience is relevant to membrane receptor signaling (i.e. FLIPR). Familiarity with the principles of small molecule library screening and early-stage drug development is preferred. Proficiency with standard scientific software used for data analysis (e.g. GraphPad Prism, Genedata Screener, Perkin Elmer Signals, and Spotfire) is preferred. Experience preparing biological buffer solutions, including pH titration and osmolarity adjustment is preferred. Ability to shift attention between multiple projects is preferred.
DESCRIPTION: Provide support for ion channel programs in a multidisciplinary team. Develop, troubleshoot, and validate functional assays. Conduct high-throughput screening for neurological disease targets. Rapidly analyze experimental data and present results at project and group meetings.

TITLE: Analytical Development Intern/Co-Op
QUALIFICATIONS: This position is in the analytical development group at Janssen working on early development of biotherapeutic molecules to help treat diseases in oncology and immunology. Analytical development's role is primarily to perform the testing and capture data to analyze components of our molecules and help make decisions towards the best process, purification steps, and formulation of our Therapeutic proteins. The co-op will train on an automated liquid handler and help craft a process to prepare samples and reagents for a more efficient workflow. They will also help to build a work instruction for the method. In doing this, the coop will be trained in the top 4 analytical assays (SE-HPLC, cIEF, and reduced and non-reduced CE-SDS). Additional experience will be gained in a laboratory setting testing assays when automation work is not being performed. They will associate with multiple different analytical groups gaining experience in a high-throughput and method development testing, GMP laboratory experience, and work closely with our automation group.
DESCRIPTION: This position is in the analytical development group at Janssen working on early development of biotherapeutic molecules to help treat diseases in oncology and immunology.

TITLE: Associate Director, Clinical Pharmacology and Pharmacometrics (1 of 2)
QUALIFICATIONS: Developing and executing CP development strategy in supporting the selection of the right dose-regimen, in the right population, using the relevant biomarkers and the right endpoint to achieve differentiation and develop a CP package that enables global product registration. Accountable for all CP trial design, analysis of data, reporting and interpretation of results. Design and execution of appropriate modeling plans along with the Pharmacometric scientist assigned to the project. Entertain strong interactions with opinion leaders beyond Janssen R&D, with a goal to represent CPP and influence the scientific and regulatory environment. Conduct methodological research and effectively apply state-of-the-art scientific/technical knowledge to projects. Introduce new approaches to problem-solving, process enhancements, and improvement of efficiencies. Stay abreast of clinical pharmacology, MIDD, analysis methodology and overall drug development process, including regulatory guidance, and methods in modeling and simulation by engaging with the scientific community (e.g., publishing, presenting at meetings, participating in special interest groups within professional societies, etc.). Assist in process improvement initiatives and SOP development where applicable. PhD in Pharmaceutical Sciences, Clinical Pharmacology, Biomedical Engineering, or relevant Biological Sciences. 6+ years of experience in pharmaceutical or related fields. Advanced understanding of PK, PD, PK/PD, and/or Translational Medicine. Understanding of advanced analysis methods (e.g., population analysis, PBPK, QSP) and modeling tools (e.g., NONMEM, R, Gastroplus, Simcyp, Winnonlin, Matlab). Demonstrated understanding of overall process of drug development including model-informed drug development (MIDD) and the overall pharmaceutical R&D process Demonstrated ability to apply innovative tools to enable rational and efficient clinical pharmacology strategy of the drug development plan. Drug development experience in the therapeutic area of interest including an understanding of disease, patient population, and treatment paradigm. Working knowledge of US, European, and Asian regulatory requirements and guidelines. Good oral and written communication skills, including the ability to interpret PK and PKPD results and prepare presentations to communicate findings effectively and influence stakeholders. Has established a strong level of expertise and scientific reputation through multiple publications and presentations. Work effectively in matrix environment, promote collaboration and innovation managing CP deliverables in accordance with timelines and overall project goals.

TITLE: PDO Summer Intern
QUALIFICATIONS: Support operational aspects of PDO clinical trials, both internally managed, outsourced trials, site feasibility, investigators and patients’ engagement, diversity in clinical trials, business transformation, strategy development, and business operation as needed, with variation across all phases of a trial (planning, start-up, execution, data analysis, reporting and closure). Supporting the trial team, including the Global Program Leader (GPL), Trial Leader (GTL), Clinical Trial Manager (CTM), Site Manager (SM), global Clinical Trial Associate (gCTA), Global Feasibility Lead (GFL), Investigators and Patients Engagement Managers (IPE Managers), Diversity Equity Inclusion Lead (DEICT Lead), Business Transformation Lead (BTL), Strategy and Business Operation Lead (SBOL) as required. Responsibilities may include: tracking trial progress towards planned milestones, as well as related progress analysis and follow-up, tracking trial and country budgets and support invoice reconciliation, support protocol and country feasibility, site selection, and vendor set-up, support development of trial specific diversity plan, support business improvement and transformation projects, performing trial specific system set-up/access management, system data entry, responsible for internal and external meeting planning, coordination, outcome documentation, and related follow-up, responsible for document management, and Biomarker Team tasks, as requested. Adherence to applicable SOPs, Work Instructions, policies, codes of Good Clinical Practice (GCP), local regulatory requirements, etc. is mandatory. Compliance with relevant training requirements is required. Assist in trial specific document management, including finalization, distribution, and document revision management and archiving, with a strong focus on inspection readiness. Assist in ancillary supply management, including ordering, distribution, and tracking. Ensure the current trial status and tracking of trial related information is always available in the clinical trial management system(s) (CTMS) and or tracking tools. Ensure trial specific data are up-to-date, complete, and accurate during all phases of the trial in collaboration with CRO, Local Trial Managers and Site Managers. Ensure trial delivery according to the agreed upon timelines/milestones by conducting supportive trial coordination activities and tracking of trial timelines and deliverables. Responsible for review/management of Trial Master File (TMF) for completeness and timely provision of TMF content across all functions. Support development of trial specific diversity plan, Support business improvement and transformation projects Run dashboards & metrics reports. Coordinate and participate in internal and external trial specific meetings, as necessary, and document outcomes, actions, and decisions. Follow-up to resolution when required. Support medication related activities such as shipment tracking for non IWRS trials, coordination of relabeling, recall, product quality compliant, TMEQ, and TOR management and follow-up Maintain key trial specific information, including trial contact list. Set-up of trial specific training curriculum and follow up on timely training completion Conduct activities that support quality oversight and inspection readiness. Work with internal partners to assist in management of activities such as country and site feasibility and obtaining country-specific clinical trial insurance. Work with internal partners, and external vendors including Contract Research Organization/Academic Research Organization for outsourced trials/activities. Assist with applicable system support, including tracking of vendor work orders and change orders, tracking, and analyzing the trial budget, including actual vs. plan trial budget spend, follow-up on variances, as needed. Provide overview of data management metrics as needed, including status of data entry/missing pages, source data verification progress, and query resolution. Participate in preparation for, and conduct of, Health Authority inspections and internal audits. Conduct activities to support timely and successful database locks. Conduct activities to support trial planning, conduct, and close-out, as delegated by the SM, CTM, GTL, and/or GPL. May contribute to process improvement and/or non-project work. If applicable, region-specific deliverables will be specified. Autonomy in execution of global clinical trial assistance services (e.g., provide status analysis of metric reports). Depth of knowledge with global clinical trial assistance services. Provide coaching/mentoring to less experienced CTAs/interns, if applicable. Primary interfaces: Provider Functional Manager, Point of Contact, Site Manager, Clinical TrialTeam, Global Program Lead, Global Trial Lead, Clinical Trial Manager, Local Trial Manager, Study/Responsible Physician, Global Data Manager, Trial Supply Manager, Regulatory Liaison, and Recruitment Specialist for assigned trials.\ Must be currently in college with a science/medicine major. Excellent organization and project planning skills.• Clear and concise written and verbal communication skills. Experience in developing presentations and presenting key information to stakeholders.

Supporting the trial team, including the Global Program Leader (GPL), Trial Leader (GTL), Clinical Trial Manager (CTM), Site Manager (SM), global Clinical Trial Associate (gCTA), Global Feasibility Lead (GFL), Investigators and Patients Engagement Managers (IPE Managers), Diversity Equity Inclusion Lead (DEICT Lead), Business Transformation Lead (BTL), Strategy and Business Operation Lead (SBOL) as required. TITLE: Toxicology Data Scientist Intern
QUALIFICATIONS: We currently have one Summer Intern position in the Biochemical Toxicology Group (La Jolla, CA) to participate in studies focused on concordance of preclinical toxicity and clinical adverse drug reactions. Preclinical toxicology studies play an essential role in drug development for the evaluation of potential safety risks. Nonetheless, numerous analyses revealed that the safety phenotypes were not adequately predicted in animals, which remains a major contributor to drug attrition in the late development stages. To improve our ability to predict human risk, there is a need to systematically evaluate and quantify the concordance of adverse events (AEs) between animal models and clinical studies. In this work, we aim to integrate preclinical and clinical toxicological data archived in different sources and analyze all phenotypic events in preclinical species and humans to create a database of concordances with statistical metrics. Experimental variables such as drug type, dose, exposure, administration route, and tox severity grade level will also be retrieved and explored in the analysis. This powerful data driven approach that computes both statistical significance and predictive power, will provide useful information to help understand (non)translatable AEs across species. The results can be valuable for assessing the likelihood of potential clinical risk based on animal observations, guiding species selection, as well as improving in vitro/in vivo work for new and better preclinical safety markers for endpoints with low concordance. This assignment offers the opportunity to work as part of a cross-functional team in a pharmaceutical laboratory setting. This direct exposure will allow the student to participate in the planning, execution, analysis and reporting under the guidance of experienced scientists. Interested candidates should have a strong desire to learn the drug development process and contribute to improving the health of people worldwide. Current master or PhD students with statistics and programming skills (R and Python), and familiar with Pharmaceutical Sciences and other life science related fields. Candidates must be self-motivated, reliable and have excellent problem solving skills. Qualified candidates must have the ability to work both independently and as part of a team and have strong interpersonal and analytical skills. Good verbal and written communication skills are required. Candidates must have authorization to work in the US.
DESCRIPTION: We currently have one Summer Intern position in the Biochemical Toxicology Group (La Jolla, CA) to participate in studies focused on concordance of preclinical toxicity and clinical adverse drug reactions. Preclinical toxicology studies play an essential role in drug development for the evaluation of potential safety risks. Nonetheless, numerous analyses revealed that the safety phenotypes were not adequately predicted in animals, which remains a major contributor to drug attrition in the late development stages. To improve our ability to predict human risk, there is a need to systematically evaluate and quantify the concordance of adverse events (AEs) between animal models and clinical studies. In this work, we aim to integrate preclinical and clinical toxicological data archived in different sources and analyze all phenotypic events in preclinical species and humans to create a database of concordances with statistical metrics. Experimental variables such as drug type, dose, exposure, administration route, and tox severity grade level will also be retrieved and explored in the analysis. This powerful data driven approach that computes both statistical significance and predictive power, will provide useful information to help understand (non)translatable AEs across species. The results can be valuable for assessing the likelihood of potential clinical risk based on animal observations, guiding species selection, as well as improving in vitro/in vivo work for new and better preclinical safety markers for endpoints with low concordance. This assignment offers the opportunity to work as part of a cross-functional team in a pharmaceutical laboratory setting. This direct exposure will allow the student to participate in the planning, execution, analysis and reporting under the guidance of experienced scientists. Interested candidates should have a strong desire to learn the drug development process and contribute to improving the health of people worldwide.
