Minimum of 4 years relevant post undergraduate professional work experience required.  Permanent US work authorization without the need for sponsorship now or in the future Passion for improving Healthcare Strong problem solving, organizational, communication and analytical skills Decision making, in-depth understanding of critical issues, and project management skills Demonstrated ability to work independently as well as in a team environment Experience in Marketing, Product Management, Market Research, Sales, Business Development, Licensing and Acquisitions, or related field Demonstrated cycles of success in a professional business environment.
DESCRIPTION: Responsible for leading worldwide product launches and developing marketing materials, pricing strategies, promotional plans, training plans, and forecasts Contribute to the development of global brand strategies for products, services, and programs including value propositions, segmentation, positioning, and lifecycle management Partner with R&D to lead Project Core Team on new product development from product conception to launch Build collaborative relationships with surgeon customers and key vendors to identify unmet portfolio and customer needs for assigned product categories

TITLE: Credit & Collections Senior Analyst
QUALIFICATIONS: Consistently provide excellent customer service. Routinely check emails received in the CRM department mailbox and respond to inquiries and/or forward the inquiries to the appropriate accounting representative in a timely manner. Gather necessary information from customers to resolve appropriate course of action, make concise decisions and sound advice grounded in good judgment. Document and follow up with customers appropriately. Help resolve billing errors and answer questions customers have about their charges and help error-check the customer’s account data. Proactively lead assigned accounts through the invoice to cash cycle to include collections, credit line administration and billing dispute identification and resolution. Review and approve incoming sales orders for shipment based on customer account standing. Perform financial statement, trend and industry analysis to recommend and establish credit lines. Take action to ensure that accounts remain within the assigned credit limits. Handle customer payment behavior through customer visits and other forms of contact to increase cash flow, minimize past due receivables and create a favorable financial relationship. Collaborate internally with CFOs, Sales, Supply Chain, etc. to create a strategic financial view of key accounts in the assigned portfolio. Provide customer metrics/dashboards related to accounts receivable. Participate in negotiations and contribute to cross-functional, end-to-end solutions to improve cashflow and the customer experience. Identify and evaluate trends to make critical business decisions based on account history and behavior. Develop business models to enable reliable payment patterns for the customer account portfolio. Anticipate and mitigate payment risks. Identify/ execute opportunities for operational improvements at a customer or departmental level to increase efficiency or facilitate achievement of DSO or other KPI. A minimum of a Bachelor’s Degree is required Preferably in Finance, Accounting or Economics Minimum of 5 years of related work experience is required Microsoft Office – Intermediate to Advanced skill level is required. Proficiency to utilize Excel charts, pivot tables, macros, vlookup features without coaching/guidance Experience in performing financial statement analysis and risk assessment is required Strong negotiation skills required. Prior work experience in Finance, Accounts Payable/ Receivable, Accounting or related (particularly in the Healthcare or Medical Device industry) is strongly preferred CPA, CMA, CCE or equivalent certification is preferred JD Edwards / QAD systems experience is preferred Process Excellence knowledge or certification would be advantageous. Strong collaboration and relationship building skills, negotiation skills, customer service skills, attention to detail, process orientation, strong oral and written communication skills, ability to present financial data in a significant way cross functionally and to different levels of leadership, problem solving skills, sense of urgency Approximately 10% travel is required (domestic to customer locations and/or J&J sites) Position is located in Tampa, FL Required to be in the office 4 days of the week for the first year

TITLE: Credit & Collections Analyst
QUALIFICATIONS: Consistently provide excellent customer service. Routinely check emails received in the CRM department mailbox and respond to inquiries and/or forward the inquiries to the appropriate accounting representative in a timely manner. Gather necessary information from customers to resolve appropriate course of action, make concise decisions and sound advice grounded in good judgment. Document and follow up with customers appropriately. Help resolve billing errors and answer questions customers have about their charges and help error-check the customer’s account data. Proactively lead assigned accounts through the invoice to cash cycle to include collections, credit line administration and billing dispute identification and resolution. Serve as the single point of contact for inquiries, requests and issues related to accounts receivable for an assigned portfolio of customers. Review and approve incoming sales orders for shipment based on customer account standing. Perform customer reviews to ensure that accounts remain within the assigned credit limits as well as assess and mitigates financial risk and raise to Team Lead if needed. Drive desired customer payment behavior through visits, calls, reports and other forms of timely and insightful contact with customers. They also employs collection technique and negotiation to increase cash flow and create a favorable financial relationship and customer experience. Analyze data, trends, drivers and root cause in customer payment behavior. This role also partners with other internal functions to create appropriate action plans to remove barriers to payment as well as provides support for action planning with data/dashboards. Identify/ implement opportunities for operational improvements to increase efficiency. Collaborate internally with Sales, Supply Chain, etc. to respond to customer related inquiries. Participate in negotiations and contribute to cross-functional, end-to-end solutions to improve cashflow and the customer experience. A minimum of a Bachelor’s Degree is required Preferably in Finance, Accounting or Economics CCE or other credit certifications are preferred A minimum of 2-4 years of experience in Finance, Accounts Payable/Receivable, Accounting or related industry experience is required Microsoft Office – Intermediate skill level is required (For example, candidate must have proficiency to utilize excel charts, pivot tables and v-lookup) Strong negotiation skills required Process Excellence knowledge or certification would be helpful Prior work experience in Finance, Accounts Payable/ Receivable, Accounting or related (particularly in the Healthcare or Medical Device industry) is strongly preferred JD Edwards / QAD systems experience is preferred Strong collaboration and relationship building skills, negotiation skills, customer service skills, attention to detail, process orientation, strong oral and written communication skills, ability to present financial data in a meaningful way cross functionally and to different levels of leadership, problem solving skills, sense of urgency is preferred Approximately 10% travel is required (domestic to customer locations and/or J&J sites) Position is located in Tampa, FL Required to be in the office 4 days of the week for the first year

TITLE: Business Operations Manager
QUALIFICATIONS: Manage the Resident Companies through their residency at JLABS; from application to onboarding, to daily engagement, guidance, growth, and graduation. The Business Operations Manager is responsible to establish, implement, and manage the business operating model throughout this life cycle. You are responsible to continuously manage the incoming pipeline for your respective Region to ensure a consistent flow of companies. You will monitor the pipeline to ensure the appropriate growth opportunities are presented for high profile companies. You will advise the Site Head about companies who may be ready for graduation. You will lead the process of footprint assignment for current and incoming Residents to ensure they are allocated the appropriate space to supplement their business needs. Lead new Resident Orientations, ensuring attendance from the broader JLABS team to provide a culture of support from all areas of the business to supplement the Residents successful onboarding. You will facilitate the necessary connections at onboarding and offboarding to ensure ongoing engagement, customer support and growth opportunities as required. Lead the execution of company required documentation, as it relates to background checks, security clearance, SOPs, legal permits, and other Regional required documentation. You are responsible to guide the residents on Business Registration to ensure the appropriate permits are in place and compliant. The Business Operations Manager is responsible to track company and team onboarding activities, specifically as they relate to facilities, equipment, EHS&S, security document management, training, and finances. Responsible for the business security on site which may include but not limited to background check approvals, badge activations, key administration, and management of the Front Desk. Responsible for negotiations and execution of all real estate agreements and contracts. You will be drafting agreements, amendments, and contracts ensuring they are fully executed and legally binding. You will engage legal as necessary to seek guidance on inquiries received from potential companies that are outside of the business scope. You will ensure all contracts are in good standing throughout a company’s residency at JLABS. You will partner closely with multiple J&J teams, stakeholders, and suppliers to manage the JLABS service delivery model including but not limited to, purchases, all soft services (mailroom, housekeeping, conference room management, shipping & receiving, etc.), security and IT services. This is accomplished through applying proven leadership abilities, experience, and knowledge while strictly adhering to regulatory/compliance procedures and requirements. Responsible for ensuring customer satisfaction through the effective management of the customer service function and technology platform, the JLABS Help Center. You are accountable for planning, organizing, and directing staff in providing timely responses to customer inquiries and resolving customer issues ensuring SLA’s and response targets are met. You will survey the customer base to measure customer satisfaction, implementing controls and escalations as necessary to facilitate continuous improvements and service delivery. You will manage your cases day to day and provide leadership routine reporting to ensure compliance to SLA’s, identify problem/gap areas and improvement opportunities. You are responsible for customer relationship management, ensuring positive customer workplace experiences for all residents at JLABS. Develop and sustain business relationships with JLABS resident companies including gaining and maintaining the respect of the scientific community. You are a key contact to communicate with J&J partners, a representative to attend external meetings organized by the local authority (as required) and a liaison to share information about local incentives that could be beneficial for JLABS Residents. Support the site revenue and capacity projections for the site, ensuring that a clear record of the current and future state of your facility is maintained, and proactive risk and mitigation strategies deployed. In partnership with Finance and the JLABS Site Head, he/she will facilitate monthly meetings to report out on revenue gaps and opportunities to Finance and JLABS Leadership, identifying plans for any reduction of capacity or revenue stream to further facilitate planning and financial forecasting. Manage key financial processes, including, but not limited to, performing account reconciliation, managing accounts payable and receivable, managing accounting tasks and activities to ensure an accurate and timely monthly close, and managing monthly VAT invoice issuance process based on the requirements of local regulations, and in collaboration with Finance and Tax team. You will collect and analyze data to prepare routine management reports, including but not limited to Invoice Aging/AR Reports, Monthly Billing Spreadsheets, and License Agreement History Reporting. You are responsible for the accuracy of all customer data entered in various online platforms and dashboards ensuring consistent documentation and reporting practices. Responsible to ensure ongoing compliance in all areas of the business by developing a thorough understanding of relevant regulatory standards to properly manage company regulatory permits, certificates, and trainings. You will partner with key stakeholders within the organization (EHS, Security, Innovation Activation, Finance and Portfolio) to improve, develop, monitor, implement and update all Standard Operating Procedures (SOP’s), Guidelines, Policies and Trainings as required. Lead local Site Audits from a Business Operations perspective to monitor for compliance with applicable regulatory requirements and J&J operating standards. You will design and document audit plans and prepare reporting according to established policies and procedures. You will organize the audit flow, providing the required agenda and schedule to facilitate the audit in an orderly and productive manner. You will monitor all corrective actions according to the business and follow up as necessary to facilitate compliance in required timelines. You will routinely review internal controls/reporting results and will make recommendations for process improvements where appropriate. Proactively identify, recommend, and lead continuous improvement projects leveraging technology to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of our processes. This will include but not limited to global processes and technologies of existing and new platforms (JForce/Salesforce, HubSpot, Box, SharePoint, Gnosis, Juniverse, Yale, Sterling, iVisitor, Guidebook, Zendesk) both from a backend and user experience perspective to support seamless site operations. Lead the process for Regulatory and Government reporting per site and/or local requirements and data gathering of JLABS company metrics such as job creations, funding, and partnerships on an annual basis. You will collaborate with state and/or provincial regulatory entities to maintain a database that provides the information to supplement the findings presented in the annual report. Responsible to participate in strategic facility planning in collaboration with the Sr. Operations Manager and Site Heads to best support existing and prospective residents. You will project manage facility projects/onsite modifications and act as a liaison/subject matter expert with Residents to ensure project is delivered on time, on scope, on budget. You will be responsible to prepare company quotes and invoices and prepare amendments/agreements as required. In collaboration with the Sr. Operations Manager, you will oversee the necessary approvals required via Building, Landlord, Licensor, or customer to maintain momentum of the project. You are responsible to ensure all documentation is in order prior to the delivery of any service, working in collaboration with Finance to confirm the appropriate site budgeting is in place to compliment project execution. You will review and recommend cost controls to ensure budget parameters are not exceeded and will deliver quarterly reports on operational expenditures as required. You will be responsible for assisting in planning and implementing the response to any major threat to life safety, security, or property by continuously identifying potential risks, prepare contingency and recovery plans, and manage resources. You may be the only J&J employee on site during times of crisis to maintain safety, compliance and ensure the site remains operational and customer needs are met. Responsible for the onboarding, training, and overall day to day management of onsite Contractor(s). You will work with a third-party vendor to create the appropriate SOW/SOG and provide clear direction to the contractor(s) on expectations for the role. You will develop and implement clear and achievable service levels with remediation and escalation procedures in place as necessary. In partnership with the Sr. Operations Manager, you will participate in crisis management related activities from a Business Operations perspective. You are responsible to attend CMT related meetings with the J&J organization as a representative of JLABS. You will disseminate information as appropriate regarding updates to policies to ensure the health, safety and security of residents and team members onsite. You will actively participate in the implementation of operational and facility requirements for the crisis at hand (signage, SOP assignment etc.). You will be the face of JLABS to prospective companies, managing initial communications and information exchanges, leading tours as appropriate for prospective new companies to highlight JLABS’ offerings. You will demonstrate proficiency in the overall JLABS business model and offerings, key talking points and answer any follow up questions of the company. You will be responsible to create proposals as appropriate to provide options for occupancy to the prospective company to further the potential for a business relationship. You will be the backup person onsite to the Senior Operations Manager and be responsible to represent the company during regulatory inspections. Regional Partners (e.g., Janssen, NYGC, TMC, UofT, Children’s National Hospital, Government of Ontario, MaRS Discovery, Shanghai Pharma Engine Company, Zhangjing Management Committee). J&J Partners, JLABS resident companies, Landlord, and regulatory agencies (where applicable). Operations Leadership, Business Development, Procurement, Finance, EHS, Landlord, Legal, Innovation Activation, Marketing, and others as required.

TITLE: Senior Electrical Engineer R and D
QUALIFICATIONS: Develop and deliver robust and safe electrical systems for medical devices, from the concept phase and research through requirements & specifications, design, coding, simulation, testing, integration and debugging, to manufacturing and post-launch support Design mixed/analog, power electronics, motor control and digital circuit design and layout of simple to sophisticated printed circuit boards Perform high-level circuit simulations and modeling. Collaborate with engineers in mechanical, firmware, software, test, and other fields to build innovative solutions and ensure requirements and specifications are met Communicate status and plans to the multi-functional engineering and program management team. Help plan projects - scope, budgets, and timelines - and write requirements and test protocols Demonstrate leadership and expertise in electrical development especially for failure mode effects analysis (FMEA) and patents Document the design of your hardware and participate in the formal release process for medical devices satisfying quality and regulatory requirements Perform hardware testing for IEC medical safety and EMC standards. Design, develop and document custom tools Perform other related duties as assigned by management Live J&J's Credo by demonstrating a dedication to environmental and safety goals, polices, and procedures. BS degree required or MS (preferred) in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or related engineering field. 4+ years' of electrical engineering experience in an R&D environment is required. Proficiency in Altium Designer, OrCAD, and/or equivalent PCB schematic and layout tools is required. Experience designing and testing for medical devices or in a regulated industry is required A proven track record teaming well with engineers, scientists, and multi-functional teams on the product development cycle (concept to commercial launch) is required. Experience with bringing up and debugging new hardware and software is required. Reading, understanding, and creating block diagrams, electrical schematics, and layouts is required. Strong written and verbal communication and presentation skills are required. Experience leading projects is preferred. Experience conducting/leading electrical compliance testing is preferred. Experience in managing external suppliers/developers and conducting prototype builds is preferred. Demonstrated experience of design, test and solving for medical safety and EMC standards such as IEC 60601-1, IEC 60601-1-2 for complex medical systems is preferred Experience with control systems is preferred Experience with embedded software and C Language is preferred
DESCRIPTION: Develop and deliver robust and safe electrical systems for medical devices, from the concept phase and research through requirements & specifications, design, coding, simulation, testing, integration and debugging, to manufacturing and post-launch support

TITLE: Production Associate
QUALIFICATIONS: Operates production equipment to produce subassemblies or finished products. Interprets instructions and specifications and uses to set up equipment. Checks products on assembly line to confirm that they are properly assembled and removes defective products. Cleans and maintains equipment as needed. Notifies supervisor of maintenance and/or repairs needed on equipment. Prepares accurate records/documentation related to quality and work in progress. Troubleshoots minor production problems. Specifically: Identify, inspect and prepare for adequacy of use, the required-mandrels for production. Prepare, monitor and test dispersion / materials for production. Dips mandrels in materials and remove shells from mandrels after processed. Interface/operate computer controlled shell forming equipment used in the coating of mandrels with dispersion. Remove shells from conveyor line, load and operate cure oven. Perform visual and thickness inspection of shells. Interface/operate MES computer system, interpret SPC data output and respond as appropriate. Operates soak tanks and dryers. Flexibility to cross train to other departments / areas within Shell Processing (HTV / RTV / SPRAY) and outside Shell Processing according to business needs. Perform equipment cleaning procedures as needed. Monitors and responds to equipment and process issues that may lead to non-compliance. Notifies shift/team leader and area technician when tools or equipment need maintenance or repairs. Accountable for adhering to and enforcing all quality and safety guidelines. Identifies and elevates all immediate and potential quality, safety, or environmental issues (material, procedure, and process) as observed. Inspects assemblies and sub-assemblies devices. Reviews device records, follow established procedures, and prepares necessary documentation as required. Must maintain good manufacturing and documentation practices in accordance to procedures outlined according to cGMPs. Flexibility to cross train to other departments according to business needs. Provide training to new employees or other team members as requested; in manufacturing processes with the support of the Manufacturing Technical Lead. Maintains an updated and current training record and adheres to training timelines. Participates in Safety initiatives and programs by either joining Environmental Health and Safety (EHS) or reporting unsafe practices/conditions to shift/team leader. Identify continuous improvement opportunities for process and equipment. Helps to meet daily efficiencies by focused approach to performing tasks compliantly and safely according to procedure/process. Other duties may be assigned. A minimum of a High School diploma, G.E.D. or equivalent required. A minimum two (2) years of experience working in a manufacturing environment is required. The ability to read and comprehend procedures in English and read manufacturing blueprints is required. Basic computer skills, including Windows Operating Systems and applications or equivalent are required. This position requires a daily commute to Irving, TX for 3rd shift working hours on a 12 hour rotating schedule including weekends. Must be able to work in a clean room environment and wear clean room gowns. The ability to operate specialized equipment is required. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to stand; walk; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; and reach with hands and arms. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include distance vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.

TITLE: Director, Clinical Development - Rheumatology
QUALIFICATIONS: Clinical development strategies for assets in the immunology/autoimmune disease portfolio Design, execution, and reporting of Phase 2 and 3 clinical trials Collaboration with the Janssen Translational Medicine, and Medical Affairs teams to progress Immunology portfolio Monitoring safety of ongoing clinical trials Providing clinical expertise and scientific leadership in the areas of responsibility Leading the development of the Integrated Study Plans (concept sheets, project plans, protocols, CRFs, operational and analytic plans) and study summaries, IND submissions, and technical reports. Provides input to strategic decisions regarding therapeutic indications. Oversight of the preparation of clinical portions of Immunology project INDs, IBs, CTAs, BLAs and other regulatory submissions Authorship of abstracts and manuscripts for publication based on clinical trial data Presentation of data and scientific information to the organization at all levels Building relationships with opinion leaders and External alliances for partnered products when relevant Potential for direct line management responsibility MD or DO is required Board Certification or Eligibility in relevant specialties (Rheumatology, Immunology) is highly desirable At least two years of experience in pharmaceutical industry drug development, with a proven record of successful design, execution, close out and reporting of phase 2 and/or 3 clinical trials is required Experience in Rheumatology, Immunology or related area strongly preferred Ability to work in a matrix environment with cross functional teams is essential Strong leadership skills and the ability to influence is necessary Approximately 15% annual travel may be required (domestic and international)

TITLE: Integrated Data Analytics and Reporting (IDAR) Interns (Multiple Functions)
QUALIFICATIONS: As an intern in the C&SP department, you have the opportunity to plan, design, and develop statistical programs in support of clinical research analysis and reporting activities. How you can make a difference: Apply your knowledge of data structures and programming languages (eg, SAS, R, and Python) to the analysis and reporting of our clinical trial data. As an intern in the RMW department, you have the opportunity to learn how to write high quality clinical documents to support the development, regulatory approval, and maintenance of our products. These documents include investigator’s brochures, clinical protocols, and clinical study reports, as well as summaries of efficacy and safety and responses to health authority questions. How you can make a difference: Apply your excellent writing skills, ability to interpret and summarize statistical and medical information, Candidates must be legally authorized to work in the U.S. and must not require sponsorship for employment visa status now, or in the future (e.g., H1‑B). Candidate must be actively enrolled in an accredited University for the duration of an intern assignment pursuing a Bachelor’s, Master’s and/or MBA. Completion of Undergraduate Freshmen year at accredited University is required. Availability to work 40 hours per week.
DESCRIPTION: As an intern in the C&SP department, you have the opportunity to plan, design, and develop statistical programs in support of clinical research analysis and reporting activities. How you can make a difference: Apply your knowledge of data structures and programming languages (eg, SAS, R, and Python) to the analysis and reporting of our clinical trial data.

Participate in data collection activities to fuel insight and solution creation. Design and optimize data visualizations for consumption by management and business partners. Contribute as a member of a team with mentorship from seasoned Data Scientists, Analysts, and Engineers in best practices in data analysis and software development. Enable R&D Medical Device Product Development, Quality, or Supply Chain teams to make an impact on surgeons and patients. You will have the opportunity to use state of the art tools and take advantage of training courses offered on-site and virtually. Read diagrams, sketches, blueprints, diagrams, operation manuals, and manufacturing specifications related to assigned equipment. TITLE: Medical Science Liaison - Immunology - NY/NJ
QUALIFICATIONS: Following all internal policies and functions as the scientific expert on current and future Janssen Biotech Gastroenterology products in the area relevant to internal and external customers. Build external relationships with recognized opinion leaders to identify and address scientific needs and stay abreast of current scientific trends. Provide clinical support to Gastroenterology opinion leaders and community physicians on the clinical application of Janssen Biotech's existing and future products, respond to their unsolicited requests for scientific information via 1:1 or group discussions, and, as needed, discuss disease state concepts and in-depth medical topics aligned with medical affairs strategy. Collaborate with partners in Medical Affairs and in Clinical Research in support of Phase II to IV clinical trials, including site identification, assessment, education of investigators, conduct of recruitment events, and participation in investigator meetings. Also provide support to investigator's requests for investigator-initiated studies according to company guidelines. Provide scientific support and leadership to business and Medical Affairs partners, including training, education, and other scientific projects. Collect and communicate clinical insights and intelligence on the market environment, clinical strategies, competition, and other developments relevant to Janssen Biotech's success. Represent and support Janssen Biotech at Gastroenterology scientific meetings including congresses, symposia, advisory boards, and investigator meetings. Interpret and report findings with recommendations for action to relevant internal stakeholders. Prioritize franchise customer-based initiatives and field responsibilities, while balancing administrative duties and project responsibilities. Build interdependent partnerships by communicating openly and frequently with partners, demonstrating commitment to the partnership in both words and actions. Maintain focus and composure in uncertain circumstances with minimal directions. Demonstrate high organizational and interpersonal skills and sound judgment in all functions. Demonstrate the ability to partner with others to lead or participate in large scale projects. Maintain in-depth scientific and therapeutic knowledge, including Janssen and competitive products as well as disease states within the franchise. Fully understand and apply MSL SOP's/guidelines and company HCC/Regulatory/Legal guidelines. Function with high integrity and be follows the Credo value. Advanced terminal degree (PharmD, PhD, MD, DO) OR other advanced medical degree (NP, PA, etc.) w/ 2+ years relevant therapeutic area clinical experience is required. 2-3 years relevant work exp (clinical, fellowship, or research experience) and/or related pharma work experience is required. Knowledge or experience in the Gastroenterology and/or Immunology is highly preferred. A valid U.S. driver's license and clean driving record are required. Ability to drive to or fly to various meetings/congresses/headquarters. Travel on the Job: 70%. Overnight travel, including some weekend commitments. Comfort with utilization of computer, company applications, and remote technology. The MSL is self-motivated, with strategic thinking and strong geographical management skills. The MSL makes customers central to all thinking and recognizes/meets the diversity of customers and their needs, and consistently drives customer satisfaction. This position does not offer relocation.

Prioritize franchise customer-based initiatives and field responsibilities, while balancing administrative duties and project responsibilities. Build interdependent partnerships by communicating openly and frequently with partners, demonstrating commitment to the partnership in both words and actions. Support Operations and Engineering in meetings production goals and ensure product quality and equipment output is maintained. Responsible for compliance with all company safety, health, environmental, and quality policies. Recycling Room Management and housekeeping. Coordinating pickups, loading materials, paperwork for Oil, Wax, Plastic and Metal recycling activities. Dust collectors pad housekeeping, waste handling, and recycling pickup. Waste Oil management and hazardous waste disposal pickup. Adding, removing and disposal of production chemicals, oils, and solvents. A minimum of a High School diploma or general education degree (GED) is required . Technical or vocational training in machining operations and/or electrical/electronic is preferred. 0-2 years of related equipment maintenance experience and/or training is preferred. Ability to work in an ISO Class 8 Clean Room environment requiring gowning. Clean room experience is a plus. Basic Computer skills (Microsoft Windows, Internet Explorer) are required. Basic mechanical and electrical troubleshooting skills are required. The ability to read and interpret assembly drawings, electrical and pneumatic schematics is required. Must be able to supply own hand tools/rollaway toolbox (i.e., screwdrivers, socket wrenches, etc.). Must have strong communication and interpersonal skills and be able to support multiple teams including Quality, Operations & Engineering. The ability to lift heavy loads. Stand and/or walk more than 90% of the time and perform twisting and turning activities and in a manufacturing/machine shop environment is required. Must be able to work on the Manufacturing Site 2nd shift (2:00PM-10:30pm Monday - Friday) and work overtime as required to support manufacturing operations. Must be able to be On Call for a week every other month as required to support 24/7 manufacturing operations.

QUALIFICATIONS: Prospecting and Planning: Identify and qualify prospective surgeons and accounts. Develop and implement account or surgeon-specific plans and selling strategies to grow sales and convert new business. Achieve Business Plan Objectives and sales goals/quotas through accurate use of approved resources Product Sales: Drive product sales for all assigned products within an assigned territory or set of named accounts. Strong interpersonal communication, influencing, critical thinking and problem-solving skills required. Demonstrated ability to understand, interpret, communicate, and work in complex environments Functional knowledge of human anatomy and physiology, basic knowledge of surgery Strong technical product knowledge of surgical instruments, procedures, protocols, and solutions preferred

TITLE: Material Handler
QUALIFICATIONS: Picks finished goods throughout the warehouse as required by sales order ship lists. Processes goods and supplies including unpacking, verifying, labeling, and distributing to appropriate location. Fills requisitions for goods and materials. Maintains and verifies accounting records for supplies received and dispensed. Coordinates appropriate shipping companies/departments when shipping items and educates user departments regarding shipping requirements. Assists in preparing shipping goods and relevant equipment. Uses/operates miscellaneous material handling equipment (dollies, pallet jack, forklift) to move materials. Performs physical inventories and cycle counts. Maintains the record of wait delivery requests and notifies the appropriate department supervisor of material and/or goods that are not on schedule. Maintain the logbooks up to date for optimum material flow. Makes inquiries of inventory to ensure adequate supplies are on hand. Reports shortages to supervisor. Performs other related material handling activities including maintaining proper documentation of all incoming and outgoing materials and keeping physical inventories. Exercises care in handling materials. Responsible for communicating business related issues or opportunities to next management level. Receiving and greeting visitors. Responsible for ensuring personal and Company compliance with all Federal, State, local and Company regulations, policies, and procedures. Demonstrate independent understanding and application of core GMP fundamentals, including but not limited to: Data Integrity (DI), Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP), and Good Documentation Practices (GDPs). Performs other duties assigned as needed Minimum of 2 years work experience required Knowledge of basic functions for operation of computer system including email, MS Word, and MS Excel. Fork lift certification required Minimum 2 years fork lift driving experience preferred. Previous manufacturing and materials management experience preferred. PC skills and experience with JD Edwards, Shop floor management systems, Quality Systems, and Non- Conformances preferred. Ability to read and follow departmental procedures in completing work assignments

TITLE: Senior Facilitator
QUALIFICATIONS: Supervise the daily operations of several manufacturing departments to ensure the implementation of the manufacturing strategic goals by maximizing productivity through the efficient use of equipment and personnel. (Target minimum equipment utilization of 80%.) Plan and direct manufacturing and maintenance functions, supervising and developing individuals and teams to achieve encouraged performance standards and initiating changes for improved products and processes. Develop and support initiatives to meet quality standards in manufacturing and improve in process quality, and to meet customer requirements to ensure fill rates are met, while reducing inventory and manufacturing cycle time. Responsible for communicating measures for accountability to associates and assisting associates in meeting job responsibilities. Apply associate involvement methods as needed to increase associate responsibility and ownership. Direct and support processes to ensure production schedules are met. (Important metrics: Due date and schedule adherence, cycle time.) Interpret administrative policies for associates, reviews associates’ performance and makes decisions regarding personnel actions. Ensure accurate policies and guidelines are followed to maintain compliance with all regulatory and corporate policies (Health, Safety, and Environmental Standards, etc.). Support manufacturing in day to day troubleshooting situations and actively serve on IPT (Integrated Production Teams) as assigned. Regularly identify efforts and results by production team members and provides appropriate recognition. Support LEAN and Six Sigma Initiatives. Handle human resources to ensure qualified associates are given the opportunity and direction for growth, developmental, and promotional opportunities A minimum of a Bachelor's degree is required; focused degree in engineering, business, or a technical degree is preferred. At least 6 years of relevant work experience is required. Experience as a supervisor in a Medical Devise or Pharmaceutical environment is required. Understanding of equipment Preventative Maintenance and calibration programs and their administration is preferred. Knowledge of lean manufacturing and manufacturing processes such as Just in Time (JIT), KANBAN, etc. is preferred. Basic computer and database management skills is required. Excellent verbal and written communication and presentation skills with a focus on outstanding leadership ability. Statistical and analytical problem solving. Position requires proven leadership skills in associate involvement and teamwork, initiative, creativity, assertiveness, attention to detail, and excellent interpersonal skills. Ability to work under pressure achieving consistently high results in quality, efficiency, and compliance through individual and team efforts. Self-motivated and capable of taking a lead position in completing duties in results-oriented work environment. This position may require up to 10% domestic and/or international travel.

TITLE: Electrician
QUALIFICATIONS: Must read, interpret, and follow work instructions and training materials. Pass and maintain training and certification examinations as required. Read diagrams, sketches, blueprints, diagrams, operation manuals, and manufacturing specifications related to assigned equipment. Use process controller programmer systems to maintain programs and to diagnose equipment failures using analysis of relay-ladder-logic programs and other process control language software. Diagnose and identify equipment failures within entire the system that may not be electrical in nature, e.g., mechanical, pneumatic, or facilities. Maintain area support equipment, e.g., electrical utilities, lights, etc. Operates all portable power tools and hand tools in assigned production area; drills, wrenches, grinders, and meters to troubleshoot and repair of production equipment. Accurate record-keeping via computer management systems and/or via manual systems by inputting and retrieving maintenance data, and other pertinent data following standard procedures. Assure that all maintenance work performed on said equipment and spare parts used are captured in CMMS. Responsible for interpreting computer-based diagnostic data for predictive maintenance and other applications. Electricians are accountable to apply trade knowledge and familiarity with plant and equipment for leading a continuous improvement program on specified equipment. This will include recommending, and participating in equipment improvements, PM process improvements, and OEE tracking/trending. Work as a member of the Ethicon Performance Excellence (EPS), Manufacturing Equipment Excellence (ME2), or LEAN team to achieve specific goals. Follow current compliance regulations and standards. Perform all work in accordance with ISO 14001 principles and environmental regulatory compliance requirements, within safety requirements inherent to chemical process and high voltage electrical work, and within all safety codes, including but not limited to NFPA, NEC, applicable building, and with engineering on material and operation acceptability of all parts used inside classified hazardous areas. Electrical repairs or modifications that impact personal or process safety must be reviewed by the Safety Audit Team prior to implementation. Independently recognize and solve problems with the ability to make critical decisions under pressure on breakdowns and work towards effectively managing deadlines in completing breakdown, maintenance, and project activities. safety codes, ETHICON requirements, etc. Work within engineering safety guidelines, checking Associates holding this position will always demonstrate the ability to work with and communicate well with others, and the ability to give and understand instructions, both verbal and written. Coordinate, instruct, advise, and train other craft personnel as needed. Maintains general housekeeping within the department, keeping equipment and work area clean and orderly. Maintain inventory of spare parts and notify the supervisor when parts are needed. Does any other work of a related nature and performs other work-related duties as assigned. Follow all applicable quality management systems, and environmental, safety, and occupational health policies. (for example, ISO 13485, ISO14001 & OSHAS18001). Computer knowledge in Microsoft Office including EXCEL, WORD, and Outlook and able to demonstrate the ability to operate Microsoft Excel for data entry and interpretation (Open selected files given location, read and interpret data as displayed, tabular, and graphically). 0-2 years of relevant experience in the job field Vocational, technical, or associates preferred Operates all portable power tools and hand tools in assigned production area; drills, wrenches, grinders, and meters to solve and repair of production equipment. Performs routine and scheduled maintenance of production equipment. Possesses electromechanical knowledge to be used in problem diagnosis and solutions. Possesses a basic understanding of the use of electrical schematics for the purpose of troubleshooting and repair. Works towards effectively handling deadlines in completing breakdown, maintenance, and project activities. Ability to make critical decisions under pressure on breakdowns. Perform and document electrical-related PM’s (Planned Maintenance) on process equipment as assigned. Document all equipment service activities and modifications in the process Equipment Logbook as well as CMMS. Possesses knowledge of PLC and applications, to be used in fixing and repair of production equipment.

TITLE: QC Investigation Support Specialist (CAR-T)
QUALIFICATIONS: Interview personnel within QC and provide quality insight to complete laboratory investigation reports in Trackwise. Review/complete routine CAR-T manufacturing nonconformance/deviation investigations. Proactively work with team members to implement effective corrective and preventive actions (CAPAs) and to ensure the timely completion of CAPAs within the laboratories. Provide recommendations for the improvement of processes by working cross-functionally with multiple collaborators. Work closely with management to propose/execute improvements through the change management system. Ability to respond with a high degree of urgency to departmental and cross-functional needs and requests. Report/monitor metrics on non-conformance investigations and CAPAs. Perform tasks in a manner consistent with the safety policies, quality systems, and cGMP requirements. Minimum of a Bachelor's or equivalent University Degree required Minimum two (2) years of relevant work experience Experience in a Quality Control setting Knowledge and understanding of current Good Manufacturing Practices (cGMP) and FDA/EU guidance related to the QC laboratory Knowledge of Good Documentation Practices (GDP) Proficient in performing technical writing (e.g., deviations, investigations, etc.) Excellent written and verbal communication skills Highly organized and capable of working in a team environment under some supervision Detailed knowledge of CAR-T QC test methods and related equipment Familiarity with Trackwise (quality event management) or equivalent systems Basic knowledge of Compendial (e.g., USP, EP, JP, etc.) requirements and standards Experience speaking and interacting with inspectors Experience with aseptic processing in biosafety cabinets and/or ISO 5 clean room Knowledge of Good Tissue Practices Requires ability and flexibility to accommodate shift schedule (if needed) and unplanned overtime (including nights and weekends) on little to no prior notice Requires up to 10% of domestic travel

TITLE: Sr. Regulatory Compliance Specialist
QUALIFICATIONS: Prepare and host external audits: e.g. Notified Body, Ministry of Health country inspections, FDA, J&J Corporate Audits for the site. Responsible for effective regulatory agency inspections. Audit preparation activities (auditor logistics, front-room/back-room arrangements, identifying/preparing SME’s, etc.). Assess the risk and applicability of audit observations from other J&J facilities to resolve the impact on the site. Schedule and handle mock inspections as part of External Inspection Readiness activities. Provide timely information to support the inspection process, including those that may be taking place at other sites/locations. Provide daily inspection communications regarding potential non-conformities. Prepare responses to any external inspection or other regulatory notification associated with the site. Ensure adequate corrective actions for external audit observations related to the site, including investigations, monitor and drive timely completion of CAPA plans, perform follow-up with CAPA owners, and perform effectiveness monitoring and closure. Establish and implement an effective internal audit schedule. Ensure adequate corrective actions for internal audits, including investigations and corrective action plans, drive on-time completion of CAPA plans, perform follow-up with CAPA owners, and perform effectiveness monitoring and closure Drive compliance and improvement in internal audit metrics. Ensure the quality system is periodically evaluated and audited and appropriate preventive/ corrective action is taken to meet the business and regulatory requirements. Where appropriate, implement the program(s) for training and evaluating the qualifications of auditors. Note: Programs can include franchise, supply chain, sector, and/or enterprise elements Participate in JJRC audits as requested. Upon receiving written notification of notified body inspections update the required compliance-related events (e.g., field actions, inspections) in CURVE per required timeframes. Assure that Quality & Compliance metrics are consistently and accurately collected and that metrics are gathered at the appropriate level for subsequent analysis and reporting (e.g., site level, supply chain). Drive compliance to Quality and Compliance metric targets. Create reports and communicate performance against metrics to key stakeholders. Highlight/communicate adverse trends in metrics and take risk-based action to remediate them. Proactive identification and alerting of management of quality issues in time to resolve potential adverse effects to the customer, company image/reputation, and/or the business. Provide input into Site Management Reviews (e.g., internal audits.) to allow relevant review. Proactively communicate organizational and compliance procedure/policy-related changes that may impact sites. Ensure feedback and alignment with said changes. Establish strong connections and collaboration with business partners at the site, e.g. Quality Operations, Training, and Manufacturing. Provide compliance education and training (QSR, ISO, GMPs) to the organization in support of overall educational strategies. Support and promote the safety and environmental objectives of the facility Lead-Free Sales Certificates (requests, makes copies to send to distributors and Corporate Administrative support for Change Notifications to BSI plus accompanying documentation 4-year college degree (Bachelor’s Degree) or Equivalent in a technical or science-related field. 4-6 years in the medical device industry; 2 years of auditing experience in a medical device environment required (5 years preferred) Working Knowledge of 21 CFR Part 820, QSR, ISO 13485, SOR 98-282 CMDR (Canada Medical Device Regulations, J-PAL (Japanese), MDD (European) requirements, and knowledge of Brazil GMP and other applicable regulations and standards. Certified Quality Engineer (CQE), ASQ-Certified Quality Auditor (CQA), or certified Lead Auditor. Experience in supporting and running Health Authority & Notified Body Inspections, leading internal audit programs, and expertise in ISO 13485, EUMDR, and FDA CFR 820. An ASQ certification (CQE, CQM, CRE, or CQA), Six Sigma (Green Belt, Black Belt, etc.), or Process Excellence certification as a quality system auditor or lead auditor. Knowledge of 21 CFR 820, ISO 13485, MDSAP, Medical Device Directive, and other applicable regulations and standards. Project management experience. Previous experience with EtQ (CAPA, Nonconformance, Auditing system). Working knowledge of applicable requirements related to the MDSAP jurisdictions, and other applicable regulations and standards. Experience in quality, regulatory, or compliance-related medical device manufacturing industry. While performing the duties of this job, the employee occasionally is required to work in a regulated controlled manufacturing environment using company-provided garments and safety equipment.

TITLE: Quality Assurance Senior Supervisor, Doc Control
QUALIFICATIONS: Collaborate with business partners and provide meaningful guidance to help facilitate resolution of issues across organizational boundaries. Maintain a high caliber team through performance management, succession planning, talent management, recruiting, staffing and making hiring decisions, and training and development processes. Train, develop, coach and mentor employees. Create and maintain an environment that serves as a learning atmosphere and fosters diversity, equity, and inclusion Cascade and translate strategic and tactical plans to foster your team's understanding of their contribution to achieving higher level goals including business unit and company business objectives. Lead the execution of the business plan by providing input on the site goals and objectives, prioritizing projects, and coordinating resource allocation to meet base business needs and support site and business initiatives related to quality and compliance. Contribute to establishing and monitoring quality metrics that serve as a key method of communication while establishing and maintaining a climate of open communication, engagement and ownership. Ensure that cycle times are met within quality functional areas. Collaborate with your team to address delays or issues and identify and implement efficiencies to reduce E2E cycle times. Lead inspection readiness activities and internal and external audits. Provide leadership and insight as on global project teams. Other duties may be assigned as necessary. TITLE: Senior Tax Analyst
QUALIFICATIONS: Prepare quarterly and forecast tax provisions in accordance with US GAAP requirements. Prepare U.S. federal and state tax compliance and estimated payments. Preparation and review of corporate income tax returns and estimated tax payments. Assist with federal and state tax research as needed. Assist with federal and state tax audits and related matters: May assist with preparation of audit documentation in response to tax authority requests. Document tax processes and identify process improvements. Provide support for other corporate tax projects and processes as needed. Assists with inter-period tax provision and allocation under ASC 740 / FIN 48, records temporary and permanent differences between income for financial and tax purposes and maintains tax basis balance sheets for deferred tax calculations. Maintains accurate documentation and testing of procedures to ensure adequate internal controls and to satisfy requirements of Sarbanes-Oxley Act Section 404. Performs ongoing review and research of domestic tax laws, court decisions, and administrative pronouncements to ensure the company's compliance and find opportunities for tax savings. Assists with special projects to implement tax strategies and/or document and support current tax positions. Supports the preparation of monthly, quarterly, and annual indirect tax returns with particular focus on the determination and calculation of tax. Collaborates with the indirect tax team and business partners to conducts risk analyses using Key Performance Indicators; identifies and communicates key risks; evaluates the financial impact of different what-if scenarios; recommends appropriate actions related to procurement, finance and indirect tax systems; applies knowledge of systems and indirect tax processes to identify unmet needs Supports the implementation, maintenance and administration of various indirect tax systems. Proficient with indirect tax engine (Vertex) and able to partner with Tax Technology team for tax assist rules and process Vertex change requests. Performs reconciliations between ERPs and the Vertex System. Collaborates with business partners to review, sign off and set up new products in Vertex. Provides timely support related to tax disputes. Multitasks to work on variety of projects as assigned. Minimum of a Bachelors Degree is required CPA, CMA, JD, MBA, Masters of Tax or other certifications is preferred A minimum of 2.5 years prior work experience tax is required. A firm understanding of financial accounting practices and direct tax compliance is required Must possess strong communication (verbal and written), time management, collaborative and prioritization skills Proficiency in Microsoft Office, OneSource Tax, Corptax Vertex, SAP, Avalara, Alteryx, Power BI 10% travel between New Brunswick and & Titusville, NJ locations

QUALIFICATIONS: Consistently provide excellent customer service. TITLE: Coordinator, Payroll Services
QUALIFICATIONS: The Coordinator will perform payroll transactions such as data entry, case gatekeeping, and quality control review of master data updates, and audits where needed. Collect, analyze, update and reconcile payroll and other payroll related data according to established timelines, standards, and procedures. Examine and verify payroll related data for accuracy and consistency Ensure all company, federal, state, local, and other applicable compliance requirements are met. Handle initial and/ or basic payroll related request and issues. Document and review payroll processing procedures. Work with the manager and documentation resources to organize and facilitate ongoing development, evaluation, and maintenance of documentation (e. g. Standard Operating Procedures, Work Instructions) to ensure complete, accurate, and up-to-date depiction of payroll processes. Ensure payroll is executed in accordance with SOX controls at all times. The Coordinator will ensure a basic understanding of payroll procedures and basic familiarity with broader payroll service center strategies. Provide ideas to increase the effectiveness and efficiency of payroll. Proactively stay up-to-date on trends and developments within payroll and compliance. Assist the manager with capturing and responding to initial payroll related issues, policies, and procedures from payroll functions and the operating companies. The Coordinator will participate in and support analysts and manager with departmental initiatives. Seek feedback, continuously learn, and take advantage of opportunities to improve knowledge, skill, and experience. Monitor results to improve effectiveness and efficiency. Assist others where possible for the good of the team and department. Adhere to company, department, and team standards of professionalism and protocol. Ensure that behavior complies with the J&J Credo and supports a positive work environment. A minimum of a Bachelors Degree is required. Up to 2 years of payroll experience is required. Working knowledge of payroll processes, procedures, controls, regulations, and compliance requirements is required. Payroll and/or time and attendance experience is preferred. Experience in a shared service center environment preferred. Experience with Kronos or SAP Time Tracking module preferred. Experience with payroll applications and service providers is preferred. Intermediate MS Excel is required (Pivot Tables, V lookups, formulas. Proficiency in Microsoft tools and applications is required. A sense of urgency in resolving customer requests and an ability to work under pressure, multi-task, and meet deadlines. Knowledge of standard business practices and professionalism in a customer service environment are essential. Demonstrate a high degree of confidentiality and sensitivity to compliance-related matters required This position will be located in Tampa FL, with occasional travel of up to 10%.

TITLE: Payroll Time Analyst
QUALIFICATIONS: The Analyst will perform payroll transactions such as data entry, mass uploads, quota balance maintenance, time system inquiries, and payroll processing jobs as they relate to Time (e.g., time reconciliations, variance analysis, error handling, etc). Review, analyze, and reconcile payroll and other payroll related data according to established timelines, standards, and procedures. Handle complex and/or sensitive payroll requests and issues related to time entries and time evaluation (both within the payroll environment as well as the operating company time systems). Examine and verify payroll related data for accuracy and consistency. Oversee and ensure Payroll deadlines are met and according to Payroll Operations procedures. Ensure all company, federal, state, local, and other applicable compliance requirements are met. Ensure payroll is executed in accordance with SOX controls at all times. Handle initial and/ or basic payroll related requests and issues with an enhanced understanding of the Kronos time systems. Review, analyze and update time data and calculate retroactive time data as required. Create reports of activities and findings to document results and review with the supervisor/manager. Document and review payroll operations procedures. Work with the supervisor/manager and Service Center Documentation team to contribute to the ongoing development and maintenance of documentation (e.g., Standard Operating Procedures, Work Instructions) to ensure complete, accurate, and up-to-date depiction of processes. Partner with the supervisor/manager to assure version control, retention, and inventory of associated documentation. Collaborate with Time Coordinators for day-to-day execution of duties and guide them regarding proper procedures, policies, and requirements. Assist the supervisor/manager with day-to-day task planning and special projects. Support global time initiatives and projects. The Analyst will assure understanding of time systems and broader Payroll strategies. Review, follow, and provide input to payroll team objectives. Provide ideas, solutions, and tools to increase the effectiveness and efficiency of payroll processing. Assist in the development, reporting, and review of metrics to drive performance, identify trends, and develop/implement process improvements, escalating issues and proposed solutions as appropriate. Assist the supervisor/manager with capturing and responding to escalated issues, policies, and procedures from government agencies, payroll functions, and the operating companies. The Analyst will communicate regularly with supervisor/manager, team members, and appropriate stakeholders regarding task or project status and opportunities to improve service levels or processes. Escalate issues as appropriate to ensure quality service levels. Participate in and support departmental initiatives. Seek feedback, continuously learn, and take advantage of opportunities to improve knowledge, skill, and experience. Monitor results to improve effectiveness and efficiency. Assist others where possible for the good of the team and department. Adhere to company, department, and team standards of professionalism and protocol. Assure that behavior complies with the J&J credo and supports a positive work environment. Provide or share time system knowledge across the organization. A Bachelor's degree is required. Certified Payroll Professional (CPP) or Fundamental Payroll Certification (FPC) is preferred. A minimum of 2 years of experience in Payroll is required. Experience with Microsoft tools and applications is required. Intermediate to Advanced MS Excel is required (pivot tables, v- look up functions). A sense of urgency in solving customer requests to ensure timely resolution and an ability to work under pressure, multi-task, and meet deadlines is required. Knowledge of standard business practices and professionalism in a customer service environment are important. Ability to excel in a team based environment, demonstrating customer service and teamwork is required. Demonstrate a high degree of confidentiality and sensitivity to compliance-related matters required. Experience with an ERP system required Experience in a shared service center environment preferred. Working knowledge of Payroll processes, procedures, controls, regulations, and compliance requirements preferred. Payroll modules of SAP preferred. Experience with payroll applications and service providers preferred. Experience with time systems preferred (ex. Kronos or SAP). Experience working on payroll projects is preferred. Up to 5% of travel is required. This position is based in Tampa, FL.

TITLE: Medical Safety Officer – Immunology (Position 1 of 2)
QUALIFICATIONS: Strategically lead the Safety Management Teams (SMT) for assigned products. SMT responsibilities include safety surveillance (including signal detection) and risk management activities (including Risk Management Plan (RMP) and Risk Evaluation and Mitigation Strategy (REMS), as well as other activities related to managing the safety profile of assigned products (e.g., Program Safety Analysis Plan). Provide medical and scientific expertise as the GMS representative on the Compound Development Team (CDT) and Clinical Teams. Anticipate safety concerns and influence other relevant functions including Clinical and Medical Affairs teams to minimize/mitigate patient impact by active participation in the design of the clinical protocols. Be an active partner and core contributor of safety input to key regulatory or clinical documents including: 	 Risk management plans Clinical Trial, EAP and IIS Protocols Informed Consent Forms (ICF), including Risk Language Safety Sections of Investigator’s Brochure (IB) and IB addenda Safety sections of Clinical Study Reports (CSR) Integrated Safety Summary (ISS) and Summary of Clinical Safety (SCS) for NDA/BLA/MAA filings Periodic Benefit Risk Evaluation Report (PBRER) Safety Update Report (PSUR), Development Safety Update Report (DSUR) Health authority queries Company Core Data Sheets (CCDS), US and EU prescribing information Signal Evaluations Effectively communicate (verbally and in writing) important results of medical safety and benefit/risk management evaluations when necessary, to the GMS Leadership Team, CMO, and the Pharmaceuticals Medical Safety Council (MSC). Actively participate and contribute to meetings with Health Authorities and external key opinion leaders. Provide medical safety leadership on due diligence teams to evaluate Licensing & Acquisition opportunities. Provide medical oversight to contractors and non-physician staff involved in preparing written safety evaluations for their assigned products. This will include: 	 Defining the safety question or issue requiring medical safety assessment Developing the strategy for the safety review and analysis Interpreting results and determining the medical importance of question or issue Reviewing and approving (i.e., signatory) medical assessment reports, e.g. ad hoc safety reports Work across the GMS TAs to align and improve common processes including providing strong leadership and a harmonized approach across clinical teams for safety data collection, assessment, and safety-related processes and issues. Assist in the creation, review and implementation of new SOPs, Work Instructions, guidelines, documents and other tools pertaining to safety assessment and risk management. Takes a leadership role in influencing senior management and key stakeholders across the business to achieve strategic goals. Leads others by example in influencing internal and external partners; demonstrates openness and seeks to understand different perspectives; gains the trust of others; asserts personal ideas and opinions using persuasion to influence others; demonstrates excellent negotiation skills. Gathers diverse viewpoints; proactively influences others appropriately across departments, functional areas, and with external partners. Lead or actively participate in department-wide initiatives. DESCRIPTION: Strategically lead the Safety Management Teams (SMT) for assigned products. SMT responsibilities include safety surveillance (including signal detection) and risk management activities (including Risk Management Plan (RMP) and Risk Evaluation and Mitigation Strategy (REMS), as well as other activities related to managing the safety profile of assigned products (e.g., Program Safety Analysis Plan). Provide medical and scientific expertise as the GMS representative on the Compound Development Team (CDT) and Clinical Teams. Anticipate safety concerns and influence other relevant functions including Clinical and Medical Affairs teams to minimize/mitigate patient impact by active participation in the design of the clinical protocols. Be an active partner and core contributor of safety input to key regulatory or clinical documents including: 	 Risk management plans Clinical Trial, EAP and IIS Protocols Informed Consent Forms (ICF), including Risk Language Safety Sections of Investigator’s Brochure (IB) and IB addenda Safety sections of Clinical Study Reports (CSR) Integrated Safety Summary (ISS) and Summary of Clinical Safety (SCS) for NDA/BLA/MAA filings Periodic Benefit Risk Evaluation Report (PBRER) Safety Update Report (PSUR), Development Safety Update Report (DSUR) Health authority queries Company Core Data Sheets (CCDS), US and EU prescribing information Signal Evaluations Effectively communicate (verbally and in writing) important results of medical safety and benefit/risk management evaluations when necessary, to the GMS Leadership Team, CMO, and the Pharmaceuticals Medical Safety Council (MSC). Actively participate and contribute to meetings with Health Authorities and external key opinion leaders. Provide medical safety leadership on due diligence teams to evaluate Licensing & Acquisition opportunities. Provide medical oversight to contractors and non-physician staff involved in preparing written safety evaluations for their assigned products. This will include: 	 Defining the safety question or issue requiring medical safety assessment Developing the strategy for the safety review and analysis Interpreting results and determining the medical importance of question or issue Reviewing and approving (i.e., signatory) medical assessment reports, e.g. ad hoc safety reports Work across the GMS TAs to align and improve common processes including providing strong leadership and a harmonized approach across clinical teams for safety data collection, assessment, and safety-related processes and issues. Assist in the creation, review and implementation of new SOPs, Work Instructions, guidelines, documents and other tools pertaining to safety assessment and risk management. Takes a leadership role in influencing senior management and key stakeholders across the business to achieve strategic goals. Leads others by example in influencing internal and external partners; demonstrates openness and seeks to understand different perspectives; gains the trust of others; asserts personal ideas and opinions using persuasion to influence others; demonstrates excellent negotiation skills. Gathers diverse viewpoints; proactively influences others appropriately across departments, functional areas, and with external partners. Lead or actively participate in department-wide initiatives.

TITLE: Microbiology Analyst, Quality Control - CAR-T Manufacturing (Multiple Openings / Shifts)
QUALIFICATIONS: Participate in CAR-T manufacturing facility commissioning and qualification. Perform compressed gas sampling and Routine Environmental Monitoring of classified areas within the Raritan CAR-T manufacturing facility. Perform endotoxin testing. Participate in gown qualification and requalification of personnel. Create, review, and approve relevant QC documents, SOPs, and WIs. Support Aseptic Process Simulations and visual inspection of components. Utilize electronic systems (eLIMS) for execution and documentation of testing. Perform peer data review/approval of laboratory data. Initiate quality investigations related to environmental monitoring. Perform tasks in a manner consistent with the safety policies, quality systems and cGMP requirements. Minimum of a Bachelor’s or equivalent University degree required; focused degree in Biological Science or equivalent technical field preferred Minimum two (2) years of relevant work experience Experience within the biological and/or pharmaceutical industry Microbiology experience related to manufacturing Detailed knowledge of Microbiology testing and sampling methods, techniques, and related equipment Aseptic processing in ISO 5 cleanroom Knowledge of cGMP regulations and Good Documentation Practices (GDP) Excellent written and verbal communication skills Highly organized and capable of working in a flexible team environment with a positive attitude under some supervision Knowledge of Microbiology laboratory techniques such as endotoxin testing, sterility testing, bioburden testing, growth promotion testing, and/or microbial isolation Experience working with cell therapy Knowledge of FDA/EU guidance related to manufacturing of cell-based products as well as knowledge of Good Tissue Practices (GTP) Trending using statistical analysis Requires ability to work in an aseptic processing environment (ISO 7 or ISO 8) and adhere to cleanroom gowning procedures Requires ability to occasionally lift up to 20 lbs Requires flexibility and ability to work available 10-hour shifts, including providing support on the weekends or other shifts and accommodate unplanned overtime on little to no prior notice; shifts include: 2:00pm - 1:30am (Sunday - Wednesday), 2:00pm - 1:30am (Wednesday - Saturday), 7:00am - 5:30pm (Sunday - Wednesday), and 7:00am - 5:30pm (Wednesday - Saturday)

TITLE: Quality Assurance Associate III (QPIP), CAR-T Manufacturing
QUALIFICATIONS: Work with Process Development team and Operations organization to successfully transfer process to cGMP facility to manufacture products. Support drafting of standard operating procedures and batch records. Approve printed documents prior to use on the manufacturing floor. Support on process aseptic process simulations of the processes to ensure sterility of the product/process is not compromised. Real time review of all documentation and reporting in support of process unit operations. Support material release in SAP for In-house reagents. Ensure non-conformances are investigated thoroughly and approved in a timely manner and appropriate corrective and preventive action plans are implemented. Strive to reduce non-conformances in supported areas by proactively driving compliance. Perform tasks in a manner consistent with the safety policies, quality systems and cGMP requirements. Organization of Document Control room and preparation of completed Batch Records documents retransfers QA Document Control and Archival Monitor warehouse, manufacturing, and manufacturing support activities for CG MP compliance through spot checks/internal audits. Other duties will be assigned, as the need arises. Support clean room activities. Provider QA shop floor support for extended periods of time. Responsibilities will include but not limited to tasks mentioned above. Minimum of a bachelor’s or equivalent University Degree required; focused degree preferred in Science, Biology/Biotechnology, Cell/Gene Therapy, or equivalent technical field. Minimum 4 years of relevant work experience. Experience with Quality Assurance, Manufacturing or Engineering. Knowledge and solid understanding of current Good Manufacturing Practices (cGMP) regulations and FDA/EU guidelines. Highly organized, with demonstrated attention to detail and ability to follow the procedures with minimal direction. Strong interpersonal skills, positive mentality, and capability of working in a collaborative team environment. Proficient verbal communication skills, with the ability to optimally summarize and present results. Experience with aseptic processing in ISO 5 clean room. Knowledge of cGMP regulations and FDA/EU guidance related to manufacturing of cell-based products as well as knowledge of Good Tissue Practices. Good written and verbal communication skills are required. Ability to summarize and present results, and experience with team-based collaborations is a must. Ability to collaborate well with stakeholders, customers, and peers. Ability to manage conflict and issues that arise with internal or external customers. Ability to handle multiple tasks on same time. Must exhibit strong decision-making ability and think creatively while maintaining compliance and quality. Familiarity with SAP, MES (electronic batch records), TrackWise (quality event management), or equivalent systems. Requires ability and flexibility to work 10-hour shifts between the operational hours of 2:00PM-12:30 PM (Sunday-Wednesday/ Wednesday-Saturday), and provide occasional support including nights, weekends, or other shifts with little or no prior notice. Requires the ability to meet the physical demands (lift to 20 lbs. stand or sit for extended periods of time in a clean room environment), to perform visual inspections of materials (color, appearance, particles, etc.) and to document observations during manufacturing. Domestic travel of up to 10% for this position The anticipated base pay range for this position is $73,000 to $85,000.
